type="integer" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.4.m4.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.4.m4.1.1.1.1">620928</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.4.m4.2c">\numprint{620928}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) of profit between the Ethereum block&nbsp;<math id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="9,100,000" display="inline"><semantics id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3a"><mrow id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.4.2" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.4.1.cmml"><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.1.1" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.1.1.cmml">9</mn><mo id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.4.2.1" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.2.2" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.2.2.cmml">100</mn><mo id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.4.2.2" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.3" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.3.cmml">000</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3b"><list id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.4.1.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.4.2"><cn type="integer" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.1.1">9</cn><cn type="integer" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.2.2.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.2.2">100</cn><cn type="integer" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.3.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3.3">000</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.5.m5.3c">9,100,000</annotation></semantics></math> to&nbsp;<math id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="10,050,000" display="inline"><semantics id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3a"><mrow id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.4.2" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.4.1.cmml"><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.1.1" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml">10</mn><mo id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.4.2.1" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.2.2" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.2.2.cmml">050</mn><mo id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.4.2.2" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.3" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.3.cmml">000</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3b"><list id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.4.1.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.4.2"><cn type="integer" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.1.1">10</cn><cn type="integer" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.2.2.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.2.2">050</cn><cn type="integer" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.3.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3.3">000</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.6.m6.3c">10,050,000</annotation></semantics></math> (<math id="S1.I1.i4.p1.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="150" display="inline"><semantics id="S1.I1.i4.p1.7.m7.1a"><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.7.m7.1.1" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.7.m7.1.1.cmml">150</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.7.m7.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.7.m7.1.1">150</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.7.m7.1c">150</annotation></semantics></math> days from December&nbsp;2019 to May&nbsp;2020). We demonstrate that our tools’ capital requirements are minimal: the majority of the strategies require less than&nbsp;<math id="S1.I1.i4.p1.8.m8.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{150.00}" display="inline"><semantics id="S1.I1.i4.p1.8.m8.1a"><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.8.m8.1.1" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.8.m8.1.1.cmml">150.00</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.8.m8.1b"><cn type="float" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.8.m8.1.1.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.8.m8.1.1">150.00</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.8.m8.1c">\numprint{150.00}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{60000}" display="inline"><semantics id="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2a"><mrow id="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2.2.4"><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.1.1.1.1" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2.2.3.cmml">60</mn><mo id="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2.2.4.1" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2.2.2.2" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2.2.3.cmml">000</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.1.1.1.1">60000</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.9.m9.2c">\numprint{60000}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD), and only&nbsp;<math id="S1.I1.i4.p1.10.m10.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{0.40}" display="inline"><semantics id="S1.I1.i4.p1.10.m10.1a"><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.10.m10.1.1" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.10.m10.1.1.cmml">0.40</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.10.m10.1b"><cn type="float" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.10.m10.1.1.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.10.m10.1.1">0.40</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.10.m10.1c">\numprint{0.40}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S1.I1.i4.p1.11.m11.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{160}" display="inline"><semantics id="S1.I1.i4.p1.11.m11.1a"><mn id="S1.I1.i4.p1.11.m11.1.1" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.11.m11.1.1.cmml">160</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.11.m11.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.11.m11.1.1.cmml" xref="S1.I1.i4.p1.11.m11.1.1">160</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S1.I1.i4.p1.11.m11.1c">\numprint{160}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) when using flash loans.</p>
</div>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div id="S1.p7" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S1.p7.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S1.p7.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Paper organization:</span>
The remainder of the paper is organized as follows. Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S2" title="II Background ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">II</span></a> elaborates on the DeFi background, discusses stable coins and flash loans. Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3" title="III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">III</span></a> describes how we encode DeFi protocols into state transition models.
Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S4" title="IV Applying Negative Cycle Detection to DeFi Arbitrage ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">IV</span></a> applies negative cycle detection to find DeFi arbitrage opportunities.
Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5" title="V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">V</span></a> presents our heuristics and techniques to enable the autonomous discovery of adversarial strategies.
Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6" title="VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">VI</span></a> presents our empirical evaluation and quantitative analysis of the found strategies on previous Ethereum blockchain blocks.
Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S7" title="VII Profitable Transactions and Blockchain Security ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">VII</span></a> discusses <span id="S1.p7.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span>’s blockchain security implication.
We discuss related works in Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S8" title="VIII Related Work ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">VIII</span></a> and conclude the paper in Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S9" title="IX Conclusions ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">IX</span></a>.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S2" class="ltx_section">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_title_section">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_section">II </span><span id="S2.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">Background</span>
</h2>

<div id="S2.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S2.p1.1" class="ltx_p">In this section, we outline the required background for DeFi. For extensive background on blockchains and smart contracts, we refer the interested reader to&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib11" title="" class="ltx_ref">11</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib6" title="" class="ltx_ref">6</a>]</cite>.</p>
</div>
<section id="S2.SS1" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S2.SS1.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">II-A</span> </span><span id="S2.SS1.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Decentralized Finance (DeFi)</span>
</h3>

<div id="S2.SS1.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S2.SS1.p1.1" class="ltx_p">Decentralized Finance&nbsp;(DeFi) refers to a financial ecosystem that is built on top of (permissionless) blockchains&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib59" title="" class="ltx_ref">59</a>]</cite>. DeFi supports a multitude of different financial applications&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib24" title="" class="ltx_ref">24</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib58" title="" class="ltx_ref">58</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib30" title="" class="ltx_ref">30</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib27" title="" class="ltx_ref">27</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib24" title="" class="ltx_ref">24</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib3" title="" class="ltx_ref">3</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib27" title="" class="ltx_ref">27</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib4" title="" class="ltx_ref">4</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib24" title="" class="ltx_ref">24</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib53" title="" class="ltx_ref">53</a>]</cite>. The current DeFi landscape is mostly built upon smart contract enabled blockchains (e.g., Ethereum). We briefly summarize relevant DeFi platforms.</p>
</div>
<div id="S2.SS1.p2" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S2.SS1.p2.13" class="ltx_p"><span id="S2.SS1.p2.13.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Automated Market Maker&nbsp;(AMM):</span> In traditional finance, asset exchanges are usually operated in the form of order matching. Asks and bids are matched in a centralized limit order book, typically following the FIFO principle <cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib17" title="" class="ltx_ref">17</a>]</cite>. In DeFi, such an order matching mechanism would be inefficient because the number of transactions per second supported by the underlying blockchain is usually limited. Therefore, AMM minimizes the number of transactions required to balance an on-chain asset exchange. AMM allows liquidity providers, the traders who are willing to provide liquidity to the market, to deposit assets into a liquidity pool. Liquidity takers then directly trade against the AMM liquidity pool according to a predefined pricing mechanism. The constant product AMM is currently the most common model (adopted by over&nbsp;<math id="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="66\%" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1a"><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml">66</mn><mo id="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml">%</mo></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.1">percent</csymbol><cn type="integer" id="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.2">66</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.1.m1.1c">66\%</annotation></semantics></math> of the AMM DEX), where the core idea is to keep the product of the asset amounts in the liquidity pool constant. Consider a constant product AMM that trades the asset pair <math id="S2.SS1.p2.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="X" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml">X</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.2.m2.1b"><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1">𝑋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.2.m2.1c">X</annotation></semantics></math>/<math id="S2.SS1.p2.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="Y" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.3.m3.1a"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.3.m3.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml">Y</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.3.m3.1b"><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.3.m3.1.1">𝑌</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.3.m3.1c">Y</annotation></semantics></math>. <math id="S2.SS1.p2.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="x" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.4.m4.1a"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.4.m4.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.4.m4.1.1.cmml">x</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.4.m4.1b"><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.4.m4.1.1">𝑥</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.4.m4.1c">x</annotation></semantics></math> and <math id="S2.SS1.p2.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="y" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.5.m5.1a"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.5.m5.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.5.m5.1.1.cmml">y</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.5.m5.1b"><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.5.m5.1.1">𝑦</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.5.m5.1c">y</annotation></semantics></math> are the amount of <math id="S2.SS1.p2.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="X" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.6.m6.1a"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.6.m6.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.6.m6.1.1.cmml">X</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.6.m6.1b"><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.6.m6.1.1">𝑋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.6.m6.1c">X</annotation></semantics></math> and <math id="S2.SS1.p2.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="Y" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.7.m7.1a"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.7.m7.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.7.m7.1.1.cmml">Y</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.7.m7.1b"><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.7.m7.1.1">𝑌</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.7.m7.1c">Y</annotation></semantics></math> respectively in the liquidity pool. A liquidity taker attempts to sell <math id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\Delta x" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1a"><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.cmml"><mi mathvariant="normal" id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.2.cmml">Δ</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.3.cmml">x</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1b"><apply id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1"><times id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.1"></times><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.2">Δ</ci><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1.1.3">𝑥</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.8.m8.1c">\Delta x</annotation></semantics></math> of <math id="S2.SS1.p2.9.m9.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="X" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.9.m9.1a"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.9.m9.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.9.m9.1.1.cmml">X</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.9.m9.1b"><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.9.m9.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.9.m9.1.1">𝑋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.9.m9.1c">X</annotation></semantics></math> and get <math id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\Delta y" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1a"><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.cmml"><mi mathvariant="normal" id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.2.cmml">Δ</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.3.cmml">y</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1b"><apply id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1"><times id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.1"></times><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.2">Δ</ci><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1.1.3">𝑦</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.10.m10.1c">\Delta y</annotation></semantics></math> of <math id="S2.SS1.p2.11.m11.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="Y" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.11.m11.1a"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.11.m11.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.11.m11.1.1.cmml">Y</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.11.m11.1b"><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.11.m11.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.11.m11.1.1">𝑌</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.11.m11.1c">Y</annotation></semantics></math> in exchange. The constant product rule stipulates that <math id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="x\times y=(x+\Delta x)\times(y-\Delta y)" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2a"><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.cmml"><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.cmml"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.2.cmml">x</mi><mo lspace="0.222em" rspace="0.222em" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.1.cmml">×</mo><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.3.cmml">y</mi></mrow><mo id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.3.cmml">=</mo><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.cmml"><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml">(</mo><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.2.cmml">x</mi><mo id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml">+</mo><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.cmml"><mi mathvariant="normal" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.2.cmml">Δ</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.1.cmml">​</mo><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.3.cmml">x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="0.055em" stretchy="false" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml">)</mo></mrow><mo rspace="0.222em" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.3.cmml">×</mo><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.cmml">(</mo><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.2.cmml">y</mi><mo id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.1.cmml">−</mo><mrow id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.cmml"><mi mathvariant="normal" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.2" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.2.cmml">Δ</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.1.cmml">​</mo><mi id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.3.cmml">y</mi></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.3" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2b"><apply id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2"><eq id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.3"></eq><apply id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4"><times id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.1"></times><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.2.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.2">𝑥</ci><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.3.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.4.3">𝑦</ci></apply><apply id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2"><times id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.3"></times><apply id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1"><plus id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.1"></plus><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.2">𝑥</ci><apply id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3"><times id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.1"></times><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.2.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.2">Δ</ci><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.3.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.3">𝑥</ci></apply></apply><apply id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1"><minus id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.1"></minus><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.2">𝑦</ci><apply id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3"><times id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.1"></times><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.2.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.2">Δ</ci><ci id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.3.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2.2.2.2.1.1.3.3">𝑦</ci></apply></apply></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.12.m12.2c">x\times y=(x+\Delta x)\times(y-\Delta y)</annotation></semantics></math>. Uniswap&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib58" title="" class="ltx_ref">58</a>]</cite> is the most dominating constant product AMM with a market capitalization of&nbsp;<math id="S2.SS1.p2.13.m13.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="1.4" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p2.13.m13.1a"><mn id="S2.SS1.p2.13.m13.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p2.13.m13.1.1.cmml">1.4</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p2.13.m13.1b"><cn type="float" id="S2.SS1.p2.13.m13.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p2.13.m13.1.1">1.4</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p2.13.m13.1c">1.4</annotation></semantics></math>B USD&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib52" title="" class="ltx_ref">52</a>]</cite>. Variant AMMs utilize different pricing formulas, e.g., Bancor&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib40" title="" class="ltx_ref">40</a>]</cite>, while other platforms (e.g., Kyber&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib46" title="" class="ltx_ref">46</a>]</cite>) aggregate AMMs. When receiving an order from a user, these platforms redirect the order to the AMM, which provides the best asset price.</p>
</div>
<div id="S2.SS1.p3" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S2.SS1.p3.2" class="ltx_p"><span id="S2.SS1.p3.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Stablecoin:</span>
Stablecoins are a class of cryptocurrencies designed to alleviate the blockchain price volatility&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib49" title="" class="ltx_ref">49</a>]</cite>. The most salient solution for stabilization is to peg the price of stablecoins to a less-volatile currency (e.g., USD)&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib50" title="" class="ltx_ref">50</a>]</cite>. There exist over&nbsp;<math id="S2.SS1.p3.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="200" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p3.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S2.SS1.p3.1.m1.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml">200</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p3.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S2.SS1.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p3.1.m1.1.1">200</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p3.1.m1.1c">200</annotation></semantics></math> stablecoin projects announced since&nbsp;2014&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib2" title="" class="ltx_ref">2</a>]</cite>. Among them, SAI and DAI developed by MakerDAO&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib30" title="" class="ltx_ref">30</a>]</cite> have received extensive attention. Both SAI and DAI are collateral-backed stablecoins. SAI is collateralized solely by ETH, whereas DAI is an SAI upgrade to support multiple assets as collateral. At the time of writing, the collateral locked in MakerDAO amounts to&nbsp;<math id="S2.SS1.p3.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="2.73" display="inline"><semantics id="S2.SS1.p3.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S2.SS1.p3.2.m2.1.1" xref="S2.SS1.p3.2.m2.1.1.cmml">2.73</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S2.SS1.p3.2.m2.1b"><cn type="float" id="S2.SS1.p3.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S2.SS1.p3.2.m2.1.1">2.73</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S2.SS1.p3.2.m2.1c">2.73</annotation></semantics></math>B USD&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib52" title="" class="ltx_ref">52</a>]</cite>.</p>
</div>
<div id="S2.SS1.p4" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S2.SS1.p4.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S2.SS1.p4.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Flash Loans:</span>
The Ethereum blockchain operates similarly to a replicated state machine. Transactions trigger state transitions and provide the input data necessary for the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) state to change according to rules set by smart contracts. Interestingly, the EVM state is only affected by a transaction if the transaction executes without failure. In the case of a failed transaction, the EVM state is reverted to the previous state, but the transaction fees are still paid to miners (as in to avoid Denial of Service attacks). A transaction can fail due to the following three reasons: Either the transaction sender did not specify a sufficient amount of transaction fees, or the transaction does not meet a condition set forth by the interacting smart contract, or the transaction is conflicting (e.g., double-spending) with another transaction.</p>
</div>
<div id="S2.SS1.p5" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S2.SS1.p5.1" class="ltx_p">This concept of a state reversion enables the introduction of flash loans, short-lived loans that execute atomically within only one blockchain transaction. Within a single transaction, (i) the loan is taken from a liquidity pool, (ii) the loan is put to use, and (iii) the loan (plus interest payment) is paid back to the flash loan pool. If the third condition is not met, i.e., the loan plus interests are not paid back, then the entire flash loan transaction fails. This is equivalent to the case that the loan was never issued because the EVM state is not modified out of the result of a failed transaction.</p>
</div>
<div id="S2.SS1.p6" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S2.SS1.p6.1" class="ltx_p">Flash loans, therefore, entail two interesting properties. First, the lender is guaranteed that the borrower will repay the loan. If the repayment is not performed, the loan would not be given. Second, the borrower can technically request any amount of capital, up to the amount of funds available in a flash loan pool, given a constant payment which corresponds to the blockchain transaction fees (about&nbsp;10 USD for the most common flash loan providers). The borrower hence can have access to millions of USD with just a few initial USD and hence is not exposed to the currency risk of the lent asset.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<section id="S3" class="ltx_section">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_title_section">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_section">III </span><span id="S3.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFi Modeling</span>
</h2>

<div id="S3.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.p1.2" class="ltx_p">We proceed to introduce our system, trader, and state transition model for the interaction between DeFi platforms. On a high level, our model state consists of the DeFi market states, as well as the cryptocurrency asset balances of a trader <math id="S3.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.p1.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S3.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.p1.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S3.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.p1.1.m1.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.p1.1.m1.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math>. The transitions represent DeFi actions performed by the trader <math id="S3.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.p1.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S3.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S3.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.p1.2.m2.1b"><ci id="S3.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.p1.2.m2.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.p1.2.m2.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math> on the respective DeFi platforms. The goal of the trader is to maximize the amount of cryptocurrency assets held.</p>
</div>
<section id="S3.SS1" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S3.SS1.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">III-A</span> </span><span id="S3.SS1.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">System Model</span>
</h3>

<div id="S3.SS1.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.SS1.p1.2" class="ltx_p">Our system consists of a blockchain with financial cryptocurrency assets (i.e., coins or tokens). Cryptocurrency assets can be used within DeFi platforms (i.e., markets), such as exchanges, lending, and borrowing platforms. Each DeFi platform offers a set of <em id="S3.SS1.p1.2.1" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">actions</em>, which can be triggered by a transaction. Actions take an asset as input and yield, for instance, another asset as output. Multiple actions can be encapsulated in one transaction and executed atomically in sequence. A <em id="S3.SS1.p1.2.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">path</em>, is a sequence of actions across DeFi platforms. We denote as <em id="S3.SS1.p1.2.3" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">strategy</em> (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3.F2" title="Figure 2 ‣ III-A System Model ‣ III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">2</span></a>), or transaction, a path with parameters for each action (such as coin amounts, etc.). We consider a state of a DeFi market to change whenever an action manipulates the amount of assets within this DeFi market. Note that we only consider the blockchain state at block-height <math id="S3.SS1.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="i" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS1.p1.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S3.SS1.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.SS1.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">i</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS1.p1.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S3.SS1.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS1.p1.1.m1.1.1">𝑖</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS1.p1.1.m1.1c">i</annotation></semantics></math> after the execution of all transactions within a block <math id="S3.SS1.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="i" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS1.p1.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S3.SS1.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S3.SS1.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">i</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS1.p1.2.m2.1b"><ci id="S3.SS1.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS1.p1.2.m2.1.1">𝑖</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS1.p1.2.m2.1c">i</annotation></semantics></math> (i.e., we do not consider intermittent block states).</p>
</div>
<figure id="S3.F2" class="ltx_figure"><img src="./[2103.02228] On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols_files/example-most-revenue.png" id="S3.F2.g1" class="ltx_graphics ltx_centering ltx_img_landscape" width="598" height="112" alt="Refer to caption">
<figcaption class="ltx_caption ltx_centering"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S3.F2.8.4.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 2</span>: </span><span id="S3.F2.6.3" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Example strategy across three DeFi markets, identified at Ethereum block <math id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="10,001,087" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3b"><mrow id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.4.2" xref="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml"><mn id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.F2.4.1.m1.1.1.cmml">10</mn><mo id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.4.2.1" xref="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.2.2" xref="S3.F2.4.1.m1.2.2.cmml">001</mn><mo id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.4.2.2" xref="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.3" xref="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.3.cmml">087</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3c"><list id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml" xref="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.4.2"><cn type="integer" id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.F2.4.1.m1.1.1">10</cn><cn type="integer" id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.2.2.cmml" xref="S3.F2.4.1.m1.2.2">001</cn><cn type="integer" id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.3.cmml" xref="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3.3">087</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.F2.4.1.m1.3d">10,001,087</annotation></semantics></math>, which would yield a revenue of <math id="S3.F2.5.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{7.81}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.F2.5.2.m2.1b"><mn id="S3.F2.5.2.m2.1.1" xref="S3.F2.5.2.m2.1.1.cmml">7.81</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.F2.5.2.m2.1c"><cn type="float" id="S3.F2.5.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.F2.5.2.m2.1.1">7.81</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.F2.5.2.m2.1d">\numprint{7.81}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{3124}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2b"><mrow id="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2.2.4"><mn id="S3.F2.6.3.m3.1.1.1.1" xref="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml">3</mn><mo id="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2.2.4.1" xref="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2.2.2.2" xref="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml">124</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2c"><cn type="integer" id="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S3.F2.6.3.m3.1.1.1.1">3124</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.F2.6.3.m3.2d">\numprint{3124}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD).</span></figcaption>
</figure>
</section>
<section id="S3.SS2" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S3.SS2.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">III-B</span> </span><span id="S3.SS2.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Trader Model</span>
</h3>

<div id="S3.SS2.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.SS2.p1.2" class="ltx_p">We consider a computationally bounded trader (denoted by <math id="S3.SS2.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS2.p1.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S3.SS2.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.SS2.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS2.p1.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S3.SS2.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS2.p1.1.m1.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS2.p1.1.m1.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math>) which is capable of executing transactions (i.e., perform actions) across a set of DeFi platforms. <math id="S3.SS2.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS2.p1.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S3.SS2.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S3.SS2.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS2.p1.2.m2.1b"><ci id="S3.SS2.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS2.p1.2.m2.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS2.p1.2.m2.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math>’s cryptocurrency assets are limited by the supply of liquidity available in public flash loan pools&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib53" title="" class="ltx_ref">53</a>]</cite>. The trader is capable of reading the blockchain contents but is not expected to observe unconfirmed blockchain transactions on the network layer. We assume that the trader is capable of placing a transaction ahead of other DeFi transactions within a future blockchain block. Practically, this requires the trader to pay a higher transaction fee, as most miners appear to order transactions based on gas price. We assume that the trader is not colluding with a miner, while this may present an interesting avenue for future work.</p>
</div>
<div id="S3.SS2.p2" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.SS2.p2.1" class="ltx_p">We assume that the trader is operating on the blockchain head, i.e., the most recently mined, valid block, of the respective blockchain. In the case of a Proof-of-Work (PoW) blockchain, the most recent block shall also be the one with the most PoW (i.e., the greatest difficulty). For simplicity, we ignore complications resulting from blockchain forks.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S3.SS3" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S3.SS3.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">III-C</span> </span><span id="S3.SS3.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Notation</span>
</h3>

<div id="S3.SS3.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.SS3.p1.1" class="ltx_p">To ease the understanding of the following paragraphs, we proceed by introducing the utilized notation.</p>
</div>
<div id="S3.SS3.p2" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S3.SS3.p2.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S3.SS3.p2.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Assets:</span> The set <math id="S3.SS3.p2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="C" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p2.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml">C</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p2.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p2.1.m1.1.1">𝐶</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p2.1.m1.1c">C</annotation></semantics></math> denotes the collection of cryptocurrency assets, which the trader uses to generate trading strategies.</p>
</div>
<div id="S3.SS3.p3" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S3.SS3.p3.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S3.SS3.p3.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Actions:</span> The set <math id="S3.SS3.p3.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="A" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p3.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p3.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml">A</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p3.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p3.1.m1.1.1">𝐴</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p3.1.m1.1c">A</annotation></semantics></math> denotes the collection of actions the trader selects from the DeFi protocols.</p>
</div>
<div id="S3.SS3.p4" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S3.SS3.p4.3" class="ltx_p"><span id="S3.SS3.p4.3.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Parameters:</span> The trader <math id="S3.SS3.p4.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p4.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p4.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p4.1.m1.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p4.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p4.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p4.1.m1.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p4.1.m1.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math> must supply parameters to execute actions <math id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a\in A" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1a"><mrow id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mo id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml">∈</mo><mi id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml">A</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1b"><apply id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1"><in id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.1"></in><ci id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.2">𝑎</ci><ci id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.3">𝐴</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p4.2.m2.1c">a\in A</annotation></semantics></math>, e.g., the amounts of cryptocurrency assets <math id="S3.SS3.p4.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p4.3.m3.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p4.3.m3.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p4.3.m3.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p4.3.m3.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p4.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p4.3.m3.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p4.3.m3.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math> sends to the corresponding DeFi platforms.</p>
</div>
<div id="S3.SS3.p5" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S3.SS3.p5.10" class="ltx_p"><span id="S3.SS3.p5.10.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Path:</span> A path <math id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="p\in P" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1a"><mrow id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml">p</mi><mo id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml">∈</mo><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml">P</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1"><in id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.1"></in><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.2">𝑝</ci><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.3">𝑃</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p5.1.m1.1c">p\in P</annotation></semantics></math> is a sequence of <math id="S3.SS3.p5.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="n" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p5.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.2.m2.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.2.m2.1.1.cmml">n</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p5.2.m2.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.2.m2.1.1">𝑛</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p5.2.m2.1c">n</annotation></semantics></math> non-repeated actions drawn from <math id="S3.SS3.p5.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="A" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p5.3.m3.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.3.m3.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.3.m3.1.1.cmml">A</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p5.3.m3.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.3.m3.1.1">𝐴</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p5.3.m3.1c">A</annotation></semantics></math>.
We denote the power set of all actions with <math id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\raisebox{1.79993pt}{\Large$\wp$}(A)" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2a"><mrow id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.cmml"><mpadded voffset="1.8pt" id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.2.cmml"><mi mathsize="144%" mathvariant="normal" id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.2a" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.2.cmml">℘</mi></mpadded><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.1.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.3.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.3.2.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.cmml">(</mo><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.2.cmml">A</mi><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.3.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2b"><apply id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3"><times id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.1"></times><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.3.2">Weierstrass-p</csymbol><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2.2">𝐴</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p5.4.m4.2c">\raisebox{1.79993pt}{\Large$\wp$}(A)</annotation></semantics></math>, which consists of all subsets of the action set <math id="S3.SS3.p5.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="A" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p5.5.m5.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.5.m5.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.5.m5.1.1.cmml">A</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p5.5.m5.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.5.m5.1.1">𝐴</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p5.5.m5.1c">A</annotation></semantics></math>, including the empty set.
Given a subset <math id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="K\in\raisebox{1.79993pt}{\Large$\wp$}(A)" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2a"><mrow id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.2.cmml">K</mi><mo id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.1.cmml">∈</mo><mrow id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.cmml"><mpadded voffset="1.8pt" id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.2.cmml"><mi mathsize="144%" mathvariant="normal" id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.2a" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.2.cmml">℘</mi></mpadded><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.1.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.3.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.3.2.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.cmml">(</mo><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.2.cmml">A</mi><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.3.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2b"><apply id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3"><in id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.1"></in><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.2">𝐾</ci><apply id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3"><times id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.1"></times><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.3.3.2">Weierstrass-p</csymbol><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2.2">𝐴</ci></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p5.6.m6.2c">K\in\raisebox{1.79993pt}{\Large$\wp$}(A)</annotation></semantics></math>, we denote the permutations set of <math id="S3.SS3.p5.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="K" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p5.7.m7.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.7.m7.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.7.m7.1.1.cmml">K</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p5.7.m7.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.7.m7.1.1">𝐾</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p5.7.m7.1c">K</annotation></semantics></math> with <math id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathfrak{S}(K)" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1a"><mrow id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.2.cmml">𝔖</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.1.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.3.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.3.2.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.cmml">(</mo><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.1.cmml">K</mi><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.3.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1b"><apply id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2"><times id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.1"></times><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.2.2">𝔖</ci><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1.1">𝐾</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p5.8.m8.1c">\mathfrak{S}(K)</annotation></semantics></math>.
The collection of all paths <math id="S3.SS3.p5.9.m9.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="P" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p5.9.m9.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.9.m9.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.9.m9.1.1.cmml">P</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p5.9.m9.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.9.m9.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.9.m9.1.1">𝑃</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p5.9.m9.1c">P</annotation></semantics></math> can then be defined using Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3.E1" title="In III-C Notation ‣ III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">1</span></a>.
Note <math id="S3.SS3.p5.10.m10.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="P" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p5.10.m10.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p5.10.m10.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p5.10.m10.1.1.cmml">P</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p5.10.m10.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p5.10.m10.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p5.10.m10.1.1">𝑃</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p5.10.m10.1c">P</annotation></semantics></math> consists of paths of different lengths.</p>

<td class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_eqn_center_padright"></td>
<td rowspan="3" class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_eqn_eqno ltx_align_middle ltx_align_right"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_equationgroup ltx_align_right">(1)</span></td>

</div>
<div id="S3.SS3.p6" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S3.SS3.p6.4" class="ltx_p"><span id="S3.SS3.p6.4.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Strategy:</span> A strategy consists a path <math id="S3.SS3.p6.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="p\in P" P</annotation></semantics></math> with <math id="S3.SS3.p6.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="n" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p6.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p6.2.m2.1.1" Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3.E4" title="In III-D States ‣ III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">4</span></a>) of the model.</p>
</div>
<div id="S3.SS3.p7" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S3.SS3.p7.7" class="ltx_p"><span id="S3.SS3.p7.7.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Balance function:</span> Given a strategy with <math id="S3.SS3.p7.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="n" id="S3.SS3.p7.3.m3.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math>’s balance for cryptocurrency asset <math id="S3.SS3.p7.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c" display="inline"><semantics class="ltx_Math" alttext="i^{\mathit{th}}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p7.5.m5.1a"><msup id="S3.SS3.p7.5.m5.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p7.5.m5.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS3.p7.5.m5.1.1.2" <div id="S3.SS3.p8" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S3.SS3.p8.5" class="ltx_p"><span id="S3.SS3.p8.5.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Storage function:</span> <math id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{K}(a)" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1a"><mrow id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.cmml"><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic" id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.2.cmml">𝒦</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.1.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.3.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.3.2.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.cmml">(</mo><mi id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.1.cmml">a</mi><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.3.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2"><times id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.1"></times><ci id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.2.2">𝒦</ci><ci id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1.1">𝑎</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p8.1.m1.1c">\mathcal{K}(a)</annotation></semantics></math> denotes the set of smart contract storage variable addresses an action <math id="S3.SS3.p8.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p8.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p8.2.m2.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.2.m2.1.1.cmml">a</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p8.2.m2.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p8.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.2.m2.1.1">𝑎</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p8.2.m2.1c">a</annotation></semantics></math> reads from and writes to. These addresses are identified from the underlying blockchain runtime environment. We use <math id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a)" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1a"><mrow id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.cmml"><msup id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.cmml"><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic" id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.2.cmml">𝒦</mi><mi id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.3" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.3.cmml">𝕋</mi></msup><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.1.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.3.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.3.2.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.cmml">(</mo><mi id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.1.cmml">a</mi><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.3.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1b"><apply id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2"><times id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.1"></times><apply id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2">superscript</csymbol><ci id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.2">𝒦</ci><ci id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.2.2.3">𝕋</ci></apply><ci id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1.1">𝑎</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p8.3.m3.1c">\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a)</annotation></semantics></math> to denote a subset of <math id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{K}(a)" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1a"><mrow id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.cmml"><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic" id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.2.cmml">𝒦</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.1.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.3.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.3.2.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.cmml">(</mo><mi id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.1.cmml">a</mi><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.3.2.2" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1b"><apply id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2"><times id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.1"></times><ci id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.2.2">𝒦</ci><ci id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1.1">𝑎</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p8.4.m4.1c">\mathcal{K}(a)</annotation></semantics></math>, which is only relevant to the trader <math id="S3.SS3.p8.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS3.p8.5.m5.1a"><mi id="S3.SS3.p8.5.m5.1.1" xref="S3.SS3.p8.5.m5.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS3.p8.5.m5.1b"><ci id="S3.SS3.p8.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS3.p8.5.m5.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS3.p8.5.m5.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math>.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S3.SS4" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S3.SS4.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">III-D</span> </span><span id="S3.SS4.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">States</span>
</h3>

<div id="S3.SS4.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.SS4.p1.9" class="ltx_p">We classify the state variables into two categories, the trader and DeFi states. <math id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="S^{\mathbb{T}}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1a"><msup id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml">S</mi><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml">𝕋</mi></msup><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1">superscript</csymbol><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.2">𝑆</ci><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.3">𝕋</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS4.p1.1.m1.1c">S^{\mathbb{T}}</annotation></semantics></math> represents the trader’s asset portfolio (cf.&nbsp;Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3.E2" title="In III-D States ‣ III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">2</span></a>). <math id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="S^{\text{DeFi}}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1a"><msup id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml">S</mi><mtext id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.3a.cmml">DeFi</mtext></msup><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1b"><apply id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1">superscript</csymbol><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.2">𝑆</ci><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.3a.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.3"><mtext mathsize="70%" id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1.1.3">DeFi</mtext></ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS4.p1.2.m2.1c">S^{\text{DeFi}}</annotation></semantics></math> is the set of all storage variables <math id="S3.SS4.p1.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS4.p1.3.m3.1a"><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.3.m3.1.1" xref="S3.SS4.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS4.p1.3.m3.1b"><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.3.m3.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS4.p1.3.m3.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math> reads from and writes to, for all the DeFi actions in our model (cf.&nbsp;Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3.E3" title="In III-D States ‣ III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">3</span></a>). The union <math id="S3.SS4.p1.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="S" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS4.p1.4.m4.1a"><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.4.m4.1.1" xref="S3.SS4.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml">S</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS4.p1.4.m4.1b"><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.4.m4.1.1">𝑆</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS4.p1.4.m4.1c">S</annotation></semantics></math> of these two categories is the overall state of our system (cf.&nbsp;Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3.E4" title="In III-D States ‣ III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">4</span></a>). Given a strategy with <math id="S3.SS4.p1.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="n" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS4.p1.5.m5.1a"><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.5.m5.1.1" xref="S3.SS4.p1.5.m5.1.1.cmml">n</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS4.p1.5.m5.1b"><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.5.m5.1.1">𝑛</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS4.p1.5.m5.1c">n</annotation></semantics></math> actions, the state after performing the <math id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="i^{\mathit{th}}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1a"><msup id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1" xref="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.2.cmml">i</mi><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.3.cmml">𝑡ℎ</mi></msup><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1b"><apply id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1">superscript</csymbol><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.2">𝑖</ci><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1.1.3">𝑡ℎ</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS4.p1.6.m6.1c">i^{\mathit{th}}</annotation></semantics></math> action, where&nbsp;<math id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="0\leq i\leq n" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1a"><mrow id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.2.cmml">0</mn><mo id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.3.cmml">≤</mo><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.4" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.4.cmml">i</mi><mo id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.5" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.5.cmml">≤</mo><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.6" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.6.cmml">n</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1b"><apply id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1"><and id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1a.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1"></and><apply id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1b.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1"><leq id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.3"></leq><cn type="integer" id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.2">0</cn><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.4.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.4">𝑖</ci></apply><apply id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1c.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1"><leq id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.5.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.5"></leq><share href="#S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.4.cmml" id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1d.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1"></share><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.6.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1.1.6">𝑛</ci></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS4.p1.7.m7.1c">0\leq i\leq n</annotation></semantics></math> is denoted as <math id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="s_{i}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1a"><msub id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1" xref="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.2.cmml">s</mi><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.3.cmml">i</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1b"><apply id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.2">𝑠</ci><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1.1.3">𝑖</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS4.p1.8.m8.1c">s_{i}</annotation></semantics></math>, with the initial state <math id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="s_{0}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1a"><msub id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1" xref="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.2.cmml">s</mi><mn id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.3.cmml">0</mn></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1b"><apply id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.2">𝑠</ci><cn type="integer" id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1.1.3">0</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS4.p1.9.m9.1c">s_{0}</annotation></semantics></math>.</p>
<table id="S3.E2" class="ltx_equation ltx_eqn_table">

<tbody><tr class="ltx_equation ltx_eqn_row ltx_align_baseline">
<td class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_eqn_center_padleft"></td>
<td class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_align_center"><math id="S3.E2.m1.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="S^{\mathbb{T}}=\{\mathcal{B}^{\mathbb{T}}(c):\forall c\in C\}" display="block"><semantics <section id="S3.SS5" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S3.SS5.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">III-E</span> </span><span id="S3.SS5.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Transitions</span>
</h3>

<div id="S3.SS5.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.SS5.p1.13" class="ltx_p">Our state transition function is <math id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{F}^{\mathbb{T}}(s\in S,a\in A,x)\rightarrow S" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3a"><mrow id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.cmml"><mrow id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.cmml"><msup id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.3" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.3.cmml"><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic" id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.3.2" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.3.2.cmml">ℱ</mi><mi id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.3.3" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.3.3.cmml">𝕋</mi></msup><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.2" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.2.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.cmml">(</mo><mrow id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.3.cmml"><mrow id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.1.1" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.1.1.2.cmml">s</mi><mo id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.1.1.1" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml">∈</mo><mi id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.cmml">S</mi></mrow><mo id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.2.3" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.3a.cmml">,</mo><mrow id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.2.2" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.2.2.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.2.2.2" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.2.2.2.cmml">a</mi><mo id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.2.2.1" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">A</mi><mo id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.2.2.3.2.1" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.2.2.3.1.cmml">,</mo><mi id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.2.2" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.2.2.cmml">x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3.3.1.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false" id="S3.SS5.p1.1.m1.3c">\mathcal{F}^{\mathbb{T}}(s\in S,a\in A,x)\rightarrow S</annotation></semantics></math>, outputs the next state if action <math id="S3.SS5.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS5.p1.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S3.SS5.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S3.SS5.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">a</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS5.p1.2.m2.1b"><ci Given a strategy with <math id="S3.SS5.p1.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="n" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS5.p1.6.m6.1a"><mi id="S3.SS5.p1.6.m6.1.1" respectively, and <math id="S3.SS5.p1.10.m10.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="s_{i}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS5.p1.10.m10.1a"><msub id="S3.SS5.p1.10.m10.1.1" represents the state after the <math id="S3.SS5.p1.11.m11.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="i^{\mathit{th}}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS5.p1.11.m11.1a"><msup id="S3.SS5.p1.11.m11.1.1" id="S3.SS5.p1.11.m11.1c">i^{\mathit{th}}</annotation></semantics></math> action.
Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3.E5" title="In III-E Transitions ‣ III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">5</span></a> shows the state transition process of this strategy, while Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3.E6" title="In III-E Transitions ‣ III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">6</span></a> computes the final state <math id="S3.SS5.p1.12.m12.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="s_{n}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS5.p1.12.m12.1a"><msub id="S3.SS5.p1.12.m12.1.1" xref="S3.SS5.p1.12.m12.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS5.p1.12.m12.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS5.p1.12.m12.1.1.2.cmml">s</mi><mi id="S3.SS5.p1.12.m12.1.1.3" id="S3.SS5.p1.12.m12.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS5.p1.12.m12.1.1.3">𝑛</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS5.p1.12.m12.1c">s_{n}</annotation></semantics></math> when each action is sequentially applied to <math id="S3.SS5.p1.13.m13.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="s_{0}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS5.p1.13.m13.1a"><msub id="S3.SS5.p1.13.m13.1.1" id="S3.E6.m1.1c">s_{n}=\mathcal{F}^{\mathbb{T}}(\ldots\mathcal{F}^{\mathbb{T}}(\mathcal{F}^{\mathbb{T}}(s_{0},a_{1},x_{1}),a_{2},x_{2})\ldots)</annotation></semantics></math></td>
<td class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_eqn_center_padright"></td>
<td rowspan="1" class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_eqn_eqno ltx_align_middle ltx_align_right"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_equation ltx_align_right">(6)</span></td>
</tr></tbody>
</table>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S3.SS6" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S3.SS6.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">III-F</span> </span><span id="S3.SS6.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Objective</span>
</h3>

<div id="S3.SS6.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.SS6.p1.4" class="ltx_p">We choose an asset <math id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="b\in C" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1a"><mrow id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml">b</mi><mo id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.1" xref="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml">∈</mo><mi id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml">C</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1"><in id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.1"></in><ci id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.2">𝑏</ci><ci id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1.1.3">𝐶</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS6.p1.1.m1.1c">b\in C</annotation></semantics></math> as our <em id="S3.SS6.p1.4.1" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> cryptocurrency asset. The objective of the trader <math id="S3.SS6.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS6.p1.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S3.SS6.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S3.SS6.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS6.p1.2.m2.1b"><ci id="S3.SS6.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS6.p1.2.m2.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS6.p1.2.m2.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math> is to find a strategy, such that the balance of <math id="S3.SS6.p1.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="b" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS6.p1.3.m3.1a"><mi id="S3.SS6.p1.3.m3.1.1" xref="S3.SS6.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml">b</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS6.p1.3.m3.1b"><ci id="S3.SS6.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS6.p1.3.m3.1.1">𝑏</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS6.p1.3.m3.1c">b</annotation></semantics></math> (cf. Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3.E7" title="In III-F Objective ‣ III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">7</span></a>) is maximized, whereas the portfolio balances of the trader, except for <math id="S3.SS6.p1.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="b" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS6.p1.4.m4.1a"><mi id="S3.SS6.p1.4.m4.1.1" xref="S3.SS6.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml">b</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS6.p1.4.m4.1b"><ci id="S3.SS6.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS6.p1.4.m4.1.1">𝑏</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS6.p1.4.m4.1c">b</annotation></semantics></math>, remain the same.</p>
