</section>
<section id="S3.SS7" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S3.SS7.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">III-G</span> </span><em id="S3.SS7.6.2" class="ltx_emph">Base</em><span id="S3.SS7.7.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic"> cryptocurrency asset</span>
</h3>

<div id="S3.SS7.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.SS7.p1.1" class="ltx_p">To identify revenue yielding paths, we make the assumption that the trader <math id="S3.SS7.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S3.SS7.p1.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S3.SS7.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S3.SS7.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S3.SS7.p1.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S3.SS7.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S3.SS7.p1.1.m1.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S3.SS7.p1.1.m1.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math> operates in this work on a single <em id="S3.SS7.p1.1.1" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> cryptocurrency asset. Naturally, this can be extended to multiple <em id="S3.SS7.p1.1.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> currencies to increase potential financial results.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S3.SS8" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S3.SS8.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">III-H</span> </span><span id="S3.SS8.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser<span id="S3.SS8.6.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic"> Design Choices</span></span>
</h3>

<figure id="S3.F3" class="ltx_figure"><img src="./[2103.02228] On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols_files/x1.png" id="S3.F3.1.g1" class="ltx_graphics ltx_centering ltx_img_square" width="461" height="385" alt="Refer to caption">
<figcaption class="ltx_caption"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S3.F3.8.1.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 3</span>: </span><span id="S3.F3.9.2" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Technical design choices of <span id="S3.F3.9.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span>. <span id="S3.F3.9.2.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span> consists of three components: <span id="S3.F3.9.2.3" class="ltx_text" style="position:relative; bottom:0.5pt;">\raisebox{-.9pt} {{1}}⃝</span> a path pruning component; <span id="S3.F3.9.2.4" class="ltx_text" style="position:relative; bottom:0.5pt;">\raisebox{-.9pt} {{2}}⃝</span> a parameter search component, and <span id="S3.F3.9.2.5" class="ltx_text" style="position:relative; bottom:0.5pt;">\raisebox{-.9pt} {{3}}⃝</span> a strategy combination/execution component.</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<div id="S3.SS8.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.SS8.p1.1" class="ltx_p">Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3.F3" title="Figure 3 ‣ III-H DeFiPoser Design Choices ‣ III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">3</span></a> shows the high-level design choices of the <span id="S3.SS8.p1.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span> tools we present in this paper. <span id="S3.SS8.p1.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span> consists of three components: <span id="S3.SS8.p1.1.3" class="ltx_text" style="position:relative; bottom:0.5pt;">\raisebox{-.9pt} {{1}}⃝</span>, a pruning algorithm to filter potentially profitable paths; <span id="S3.SS8.p1.1.4" class="ltx_text" style="position:relative; bottom:0.5pt;">\raisebox{-.9pt} {{2}}⃝</span>, a search algorithm which searches parameters to maximize the revenue of a given path, and <span id="S3.SS8.p1.1.5" class="ltx_text" style="position:relative; bottom:0.5pt;">\raisebox{-.9pt} {{3}}⃝</span> a strategy combination/execution algorithm, which decides how the found strategies are executed.</p>
</div>
<div id="S3.SS8.p2" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S3.SS8.p2.1" class="ltx_p">Generally speaking, each instantiation of the different components bears its own advantages and disadvantages. For instance, negative cycle detection only searches cyclic paths, whereas pruning with heuristics can search for any path structure. Given a simple path such as a cyclic arbitrage, we find that local search is faster than the SMT solver (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.F12" title="Figure 12 ‣ VI-C DeFiPoser-ARB and DeFiPoser-SMT: Revenue ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">12</span></a>), but does not provide satisfiability proofs. In the following we present two variants of <span id="S3.SS8.p2.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span>, namely <span id="S3.SS8.p2.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> (cf.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S4" title="IV Applying Negative Cycle Detection to DeFi Arbitrage ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">IV</span></a>) and <span id="S3.SS8.p2.1.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> (cf.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5" title="V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">V</span></a>).</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<section id="S4" class="ltx_section">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_title_section">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_section">IV </span><span id="S4.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">Applying Negative Cycle Detection to DeFi Arbitrage</span>
</h2>

<div id="S4.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S4.p1.1" class="ltx_p">Previous works propose negative cycle detection algorithms, such as the Bellman-Ford-Moore algorithm, to find arbitrage opportunities<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib18" title="" class="ltx_ref">18</a>]</cite>. In these algorithms, the exchange markets are modeled as a directed weighted graph (<math id="S4.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="g" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.p1.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S4.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S4.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">g</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.p1.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S4.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.p1.1.m1.1.1">𝑔</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.p1.1.m1.1c">g</annotation></semantics></math>). Every negative cycle in the graph then corresponds to an arbitrage opportunity.</p>
</div>
<section id="S4.SS1" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S4.SS1.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">IV-A</span> </span><span id="S4.SS1.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Negative Cycle Detection to Detect Arbitrage</span>
</h3>

<div id="S4.SS1.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S4.SS1.p1.1" class="ltx_p">We adopt the following notations to translate arbitrage detection into a negative cycle detection problem.</p>
</div>
<div id="S4.SS1.p2" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S4.SS1.p2.2" class="ltx_p"><span id="S4.SS1.p2.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Nodes:</span> The set <math id="S4.SS1.p2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="N" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p2.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S4.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml">N</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p2.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S4.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1">𝑁</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p2.1.m1.1c">N</annotation></semantics></math> denotes the collection of nodes. Each node (vertex) represents a different asset (<math id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c\in C" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1a"><mrow id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mo id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml">∈</mo><mi id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.3" xref="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml">C</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1b"><apply id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1"><in id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.1"></in><ci id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.3">𝐶</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p2.2.m2.1c">c\in C</annotation></semantics></math>).</p>
</div>
<div id="S4.SS1.p3" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S4.SS1.p3.7" class="ltx_p"><span id="S4.SS1.p3.7.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Directed edges:</span> The set <math id="S4.SS1.p3.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="E" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p3.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.1.m1.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml">E</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p3.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.1.m1.1.1">𝐸</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p3.1.m1.1c">E</annotation></semantics></math> denotes the collection of all edges. An edge <math id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="e_{i,j}" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2a"><msub id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.3" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.3.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.3.2" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.3.2.cmml">e</mi><mrow id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.2.2.4" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.2.2.3.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.1.1.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.1.1.1.1.cmml">i</mi><mo id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.2.2.4.1" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.2.2.2" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.2.2.2.cmml">j</mi></mrow></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2b"><apply id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.3"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.3">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.3.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.3.2">𝑒</ci><list id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.2.2.4"><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.1.1.1.1">𝑖</ci><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.2.2.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2.2.2.2">𝑗</ci></list></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p3.2.m2.2c">e_{i,j}</annotation></semantics></math> that points from asset <math id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{i}" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1a"><msub id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.2" xref="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.3" xref="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml">i</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1b"><apply id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1.1.3">𝑖</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p3.3.m3.1c">c_{i}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{j}" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1a"><msub id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.2" xref="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.3" xref="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.3.cmml">j</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1b"><apply id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1.1.3">𝑗</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p3.4.m4.1c">c_{j}</annotation></semantics></math> represents that there exist a market where the trader <math id="S4.SS1.p3.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p3.5.m5.1a"><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.5.m5.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p3.5.m5.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p3.5.m5.1b"><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.5.m5.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p3.5.m5.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math> can sell cryptocurrency asset <math id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{i}" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1a"><msub id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.2" xref="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.3" xref="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.3.cmml">i</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1b"><apply id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1.1.3">𝑖</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p3.6.m6.1c">c_{i}</annotation></semantics></math> to purchase cryptocurrency asset <math id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{j}" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1a"><msub id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.2" xref="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mi id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.3" xref="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.3.cmml">j</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1b"><apply id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1.1.3">𝑗</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p3.7.m7.1c">c_{j}</annotation></semantics></math>.</p>
</div>
<div id="S4.SS1.p4" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S4.SS1.p4.6" class="ltx_p"><span id="S4.SS1.p4.6.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Spot price:</span> The spot price <math id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="p^{\text{spot}}_{i,j}" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2a"><msubsup id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.2" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.2.cmml">p</mi><mrow id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.2.2.4" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.2.2.3.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.1.1.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.1.1.1.1.cmml">i</mi><mo id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.2.2.4.1" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mi id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.2.2.2" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.2.2.2.cmml">j</mi></mrow><mtext id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.3" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.3a.cmml">spot</mtext></msubsup><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2b"><apply id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3">subscript</csymbol><apply id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3">superscript</csymbol><ci id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.2">𝑝</ci><ci id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.3a.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.3"><mtext mathsize="70%" id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.3.2.3">spot</mtext></ci></apply><list id="S4.SS1.p4.1.m1.2.2.2.3.cmml" </div>
<div id="S4.SS1.p6" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">

id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.2.2.4" xref="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.2.2.3.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.1.1.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.1.1.1.1.cmml">i</mi><mo id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.2.2.4.1" xref="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mi id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.2.2.2" xref="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.2.2.2.cmml">j</mi></mrow></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2b"><apply id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.3"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.3">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.3.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.3.2">𝑒</ci><list id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.2.2.4"><ci id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.1.1.1.1">𝑖</ci><ci id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.2.2.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2.2.2.2">𝑗</ci></list></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p6.2.m2.2c">e_{i,j}</annotation></semantics></math>. An arbitrage opportunity exists if <math id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4" class="ltx_Math" alttext="w_{1,2}+\ldots+w_{i-1,i}&lt;0" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4a"><mrow id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.cmml"><mrow id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.cmml"><msub id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.2" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.2.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.2.2" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.2.2.cmml">w</mi><mrow id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.2.2.2.4" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.2.2.2.3.cmml"><mn id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.1.1.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.1.1.1.1.cmml">1</mn><mo id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.2.2.2.4.1" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.2.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.2.2.2.2" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.2.2.2.2.cmml">2</mn></mrow></msub><mo id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.1" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.1.cmml">+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal" id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.3" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.3.cmml">…</mi><mo id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.1a" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.1.cmml">+</mo><msub id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.4" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.4.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.4.2" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.4.2.cmml">w</mi><mrow id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.3.cmml"><mrow id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.2" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.2.cmml">i</mi><mo id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.1.cmml">−</mo><mn id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.3" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.3.cmml">1</mn></mrow><mo id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.2" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mi id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.3.3.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.3.3.1.1.cmml">i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.1" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.1.cmml">&lt;</mo><mn id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.3" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.3.cmml">0</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4b"><apply id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5"><lt id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.1"></lt><apply id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2"><plus id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.1"></plus><apply id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.2"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.2.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.2">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.2.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.2.2">𝑤</ci><list id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.2.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.2.2.2.4"><cn type="integer" id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.1.1.1.1">1</cn><cn type="integer" id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.2.2.2.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.2.2.2.2">2</cn></list></apply><ci id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.3">…</ci><apply id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.4.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.4"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.4.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.4">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.4.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.2.4.2">𝑤</ci><list id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2"><apply id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1"><minus id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.1"></minus><ci id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.2">𝑖</ci><cn type="integer" id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.4.2.2.1.3">1</cn></apply><ci id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.3.3.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.3.3.1.1">𝑖</ci></list></apply></apply><cn type="integer" id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4.5.3">0</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p6.3.m3.4c">w_{1,2}+\ldots+w_{i-1,i}&lt;0</annotation></semantics></math>.</p>
</div>
<div id="S4.SS1.p7" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S4.SS1.p7.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S4.SS1.p7.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Path finding:</span> Our objective is to maximize <math id="S4.SS1.p7.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS1.p7.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S4.SS1.p7.1.m1.1.1" xref="S4.SS1.p7.1.m1.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS1.p7.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S4.SS1.p7.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS1.p7.1.m1.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS1.p7.1.m1.1c">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math>’s <em id="S4.SS1.p7.1.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> cryptocurrency asset. An arbitrage cycle, however, may not consist of the <em id="S4.SS1.p7.1.3" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> asset. Therefore, we convert the arbitrage revenue to the <em id="S4.SS1.p7.1.4" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> cryptocurrency asset by the end of the execution. More concretely, we find all ‘connecting’ markets that support the conversion between one of the arbitrage assets and the <em id="S4.SS1.p7.1.5" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> cryptocurrency asset. We perform the conversion using the ‘connecting’ markets with the best price.</p>
</div>
</section>

id="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.3.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.3">𝑙</ci><ci id="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.4.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.4">𝑜</ci><ci id="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.5.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.5">𝑔</ci><apply id="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1">superscript</csymbol><apply id="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1.1.2.2.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1.1.2.2">𝑝</ci><list id="alg1.29.29.m1.4.4.2.3.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.4.4.2.2"><apply id="alg1.29.29.m1.3.3.1.1.1.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.3.3.1.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="alg1.29.29.m1.3.3.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.3.3.1.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="alg1.29.29.m1.3.3.1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.3.3.1.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="alg1.29.29.m1.3.3.1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.3.3.1.1.1.3">𝑖</ci></apply><apply id="alg1.29.29.m1.4.4.2.2.2.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.4.4.2.2.2"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="alg1.29.29.m1.4.4.2.2.2.1.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.4.4.2.2.2">subscript</csymbol><ci id="alg1.29.29.m1.4.4.2.2.2.2.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.4.4.2.2.2.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="alg1.29.29.m1.4.4.2.2.2.3.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.4.4.2.2.2.3">𝑗</ci></apply></list></apply><ci id="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1.1.3a.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1.1.3"><mtext mathsize="70%" id="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="alg1.29.29.m1.7.7.2.1.1.1.1.3">spot</mtext></ci></apply></apply></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="alg1.29.29.m1.7c">\text{\# build the graph }\textit{g};\text{where }w_{c_{i},c_{j}}=-log(p_{c_{i},c_{j}}^{\text{spot}})</annotation></semantics></math>
</div>
<div id="alg1.32.42" class="ltx_listingline">&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class="ltx_rule" style="width:1px;height:100%;background:black;display:inline-block;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
return <span id="alg1.32.42.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">g</span> 
</div>
<div id="alg1.32.43" class="ltx_listingline">&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class="ltx_rule" style="width:1px;height:100%;background:black;display:inline-block;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</div>
<div id="alg1.32.44" class="ltx_listingline"> end
</div>
<div id="alg1.32.45" class="ltx_listingline">
<span id="alg1.32.45.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Function</span>&nbsp;<em id="alg1.32.45.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">hasNegativeCycle(g)</em><span id="alg1.32.45.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold"> is</span> 
</div>
<div id="alg1.32.46" class="ltx_listingline">&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class="ltx_rule" style="width:1px;height:100%;background:black;display:inline-block;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
return <span id="alg1.32.46.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">(Detects a negative cycle?)</span>

</div>
<div id="alg1.32.49" class="ltx_listingline">
<span id="alg1.32.49.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Function</span>&nbsp;<em id="alg1.32.49.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">getPath(cycle)</em><span id="alg1.32.49.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold"> is</span> 
</div>
<div id="alg1.30.30" class="ltx_listingline">&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class="ltx_rule" style="width:1px;height:100%;background:black;display:inline-block;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.cmml"><mi id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.2" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.2.cmml">P</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.1" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.1.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5c.cmml"><mtext id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5a" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5c.cmml">’s baseasset id="alg1.30.30.m1.1b"><apply id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1"><in id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.1"></in><ci id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.2">𝑝</ci><apply id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3"><times id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.1.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.1"></times><ci id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.2.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.2">𝑃</ci><ci id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.3a.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.3"><mtext id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.3.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5"><mrow id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5"><mtext id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5a.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5">’s baseasset with&nbsp;</mtext><mtext class="ltx_mathvariant_italic" id="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5b.cmml" xref="alg1.30.30.m1.1.1.3.5">cycle.</mtext></mrow></ci></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="alg1.30.30.m1.1c">p\in P\text{ connects }\mathbb{T}\text{'s baseasset with }\textit{cycle.}</annotation></semantics></math>
</div>
<div id="alg1.32.50" class="ltx_listingline">&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class="ltx_rule" style="width:1px;height:100%;background:black;display:inline-block;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
return <span id="alg1.32.50.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">p</span> 
</div>
<div id="alg1.32.51" class="ltx_listingline">&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class="ltx_rule" style="width:1px;height:100%;background:black;display:inline-block;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</div>
<div id="alg1.32.52" class="ltx_listingline"> end
</div>
<div id="alg1.32.53" class="ltx_listingline">
<span id="alg1.32.53.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Function</span>&nbsp;<em id="alg1.32.53.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">search(p)</em><span id="alg1.32.53.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold"> is</span> 
</div>
<div id="alg1.31.31" class="ltx_listingline">&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class="ltx_rule" style="width:1px;height:100%;background:black;display:inline-block;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<span id="alg1.31.31.1" class="ltx_text ltx_markedasmath"># find the parameters for path </span><span id="alg1.31.31.2" class="ltx_text ltx_markedasmath ltx_font_italic">p</span>
</div>
<div id="alg1.32.32" class="ltx_listingline">&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class="ltx_rule" style="width:1px;height:100%;background:black;display:inline-block;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<span id="alg1.32.32.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">s’</span> <math id="alg1.32.32.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\leftarrow" display="inline"><semantics id="alg1.32.32.m1.1a"><mo stretchy="false" id="alg1.32.32.m1.1.1" xref="alg1.32.32.m1.1.1.cmml">←</mo><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="alg1.32.32.m1.1b"><ci id="alg1.32.32.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="alg1.32.32.m1.1.1">←</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="alg1.32.32.m1.1c">\leftarrow</annotation></semantics></math> <span id="alg1.32.32.2" class="ltx_text">state after executinng the strategy</span>
</div>
<div id="alg1.32.54" class="ltx_listingline">&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class="ltx_rule" style="width:1px;height:100%;background:black;display:inline-block;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
return <span id="alg1.32.54.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">(revenue, s’)</span>

</div>
<div id="alg1.32.55" class="ltx_listingline"> end
</div>
<div id="alg1.32.56" class="ltx_listingline">

</div>
</div>
<figcaption class="ltx_caption"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_float"><span id="alg1.34.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Algorithm&nbsp;1</span> </span>Negative cycle arbitrage detection.</figcaption>
</figure>
<div id="S4.SS2.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S4.SS2.p1.1" class="ltx_p">Negative cycle detection algorithms combine the shortest path algorithm with a cycle detection strategy. Cherkassky&nbsp;<span id="S4.SS2.p1.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">et al.</span>&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib18" title="" class="ltx_ref">18</a>]</cite> studied various combinations of shortest path algorithms (Bellman-Ford-Moore<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib8" title="" class="ltx_ref">8</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib29" title="" class="ltx_ref">29</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib51" title="" class="ltx_ref">51</a>]</cite>, Goldfarb-Hao-Kai<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib35" title="" class="ltx_ref">35</a>]</cite>, Goldberg-Radzik<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib33" title="" class="ltx_ref">33</a>]</cite>, etc.) and cycle detection strategies (Walk to the root, Admissible graph search<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib34" title="" class="ltx_ref">34</a>]</cite>, Subtree traversal<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib44" title="" class="ltx_ref">44</a>]</cite>, etc.) and compared their relative performances. A natural question is whether these cycle detection algorithms can be directly applied to find profitable transactions in DeFi.</p>
</div>
<div id="S4.SS2.p2" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S4.SS2.p2.5" class="ltx_p">In bid-ask markets, the price does not change if the trade volume is within the bid/ask size <cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib17" title="" class="ltx_ref">17</a>]</cite>. DeFi AMM exchanges, however, follow a dynamic price based on the trade volume. Intuitively, the bigger the transaction size, the worse the trading price becomes. Hence, our algorithm needs to consider dynamic price changes and update the graph <math id="S4.SS2.p2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="g" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS2.p2.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S4.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S4.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml">g</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS2.p2.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S4.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1">𝑔</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS2.p2.1.m1.1c">g</annotation></semantics></math> after every action. On a high level, a Bellman-Ford-Moore inspired algorithm repeatedly performs the following steps: (i) Build the graph <math id="S4.SS2.p2.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="g" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS2.p2.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S4.SS2.p2.2.m2.1.1" xref="S4.SS2.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml">g</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS2.p2.2.m2.1b"><ci id="S4.SS2.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS2.p2.2.m2.1.1">𝑔</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS2.p2.2.m2.1c">g</annotation></semantics></math> based on the spot prices from the current state <math id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="s\in S" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1a"><mrow id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1" xref="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.2" xref="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml">s</mi><mo id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.1" xref="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml">∈</mo><mi id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.3" xref="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml">S</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1b"><apply id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1"><in id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.1"></in><ci id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.2">𝑠</ci><ci id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1.1.3">𝑆</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS2.p2.3.m3.1c">s\in S</annotation></semantics></math>; (ii) Detect arbitrage cycles in the graph <math id="S4.SS2.p2.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="g" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS2.p2.4.m4.1a"><mi id="S4.SS2.p2.4.m4.1.1" xref="S4.SS2.p2.4.m4.1.1.cmml">g</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS2.p2.4.m4.1b"><ci id="S4.SS2.p2.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS2.p2.4.m4.1.1">𝑔</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS2.p2.4.m4.1c">g</annotation></semantics></math> (Bellman-Ford-Moore); (iii) Build a path based on the negative cycle, and find the strategy (parameters for the path), finally (iv) Execute the strategy and update the state <math id="S4.SS2.p2.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="s" display="inline"><semantics id="S4.SS2.p2.5.m5.1a"><mi id="S4.SS2.p2.5.m5.1.1" xref="S4.SS2.p2.5.m5.1.1.cmml">s</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S4.SS2.p2.5.m5.1b"><ci id="S4.SS2.p2.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S4.SS2.p2.5.m5.1.1">𝑠</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S4.SS2.p2.5.m5.1c">s</annotation></semantics></math>. Algorithm&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#alg1" title="In IV-B Negative Cycle Detection Algorithms ‣ IV Applying Negative Cycle Detection to DeFi Arbitrage ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">1</span></a> presents the details of <span id="S4.SS2.p2.5.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>. To find the parameters for a path, Algorithm &nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#alg1" title="In IV-B Negative Cycle Detection Algorithms ‣ IV Applying Negative Cycle Detection to DeFi Arbitrage ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">1</span></a> gradually increases the amount of <em id="S4.SS2.p2.5.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> assets into the path until there is no increase in revenue.</p>
</div>
<div id="S4.SS2.p3" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S4.SS2.p3.1" class="ltx_p">We present <span id="S4.SS2.p3.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>’s evaluation in Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6" title="VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">VI</span></a>.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<section id="S5" class="ltx_section">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_title_section">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_section">V </span><span id="S5.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">Design of DeFiPoser-SMT</span>
</h2>

<div id="S5.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S5.p1.3" class="ltx_p">In this section, we discuss an alternative technique, <span id="S5.p1.3.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span>, to find profitable transactions in DeFi, which is more general when compared to <span id="S5.p1.3.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>. More specifically, <span id="S5.p1.3.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> can operate on non-cyclic strategies, while <span id="S5.p1.3.4" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> cannot. We observe that profitable DeFi strategies do not necessarily form a complete cycle. For example, Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.F4.sf1" title="In Figure 4 ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">4(a)</span></a> shows the graph for the economic bZx attack (cf.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S7" title="VII Profitable Transactions and Blockchain Security ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">VII</span></a>). The strategy requires the trader to send Ether to edge <math id="S5.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="1" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.p1.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S5.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S5.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">1</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.p1.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S5.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.p1.1.m1.1.1">1</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.p1.1.m1.1c">1</annotation></semantics></math> without receiving any assets in return and to then perform an arbitrage cycle with edge <math id="S5.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="2" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.p1.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S5.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S5.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">2</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.p1.2.m2.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S5.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.p1.2.m2.1.1">2</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.p1.2.m2.1c">2</annotation></semantics></math> and <math id="S5.p1.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="3" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.p1.3.m3.1a"><mn id="S5.p1.3.m3.1.1" xref="S5.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml">3</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.p1.3.m3.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S5.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.p1.3.m3.1.1">3</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.p1.3.m3.1c">3</annotation></semantics></math>.</p>
</div>

</div>
<figcaption class="ltx_caption ltx_centering"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S5.F4.12.5.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 4</span>: </span><span id="S5.F4.8.4" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Directed weighted graph for the economic bZx attack on the Ethereum block <math id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="9,462,687" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3b"><mrow id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.4.2" xref="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml"><mn id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.1.1" xref="S5.F4.5.1.m1.1.1.cmml">9</mn><mo id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.4.2.1" xref="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.2.2" xref="S5.F4.5.1.m1.2.2.cmml">462</mn><mo id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.4.2.2" xref="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.3" xref="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.3.cmml">687</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3c"><list id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml" xref="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.4.2"><cn type="integer" id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.F4.5.1.m1.1.1">9</cn><cn type="integer" id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.2.2.cmml" xref="S5.F4.5.1.m1.2.2">462</cn><cn type="integer" id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.3.cmml" xref="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3.3">687</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.F4.5.1.m1.3d">9,462,687</annotation></semantics></math>. Shorting ETH for WBTC on bZx does not return assets to the trader <math id="S5.F4.6.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathbb{T}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.F4.6.2.m2.1b"><mi id="S5.F4.6.2.m2.1.1" xref="S5.F4.6.2.m2.1.1.cmml">𝕋</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.F4.6.2.m2.1c"><ci id="S5.F4.6.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.F4.6.2.m2.1.1">𝕋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.F4.6.2.m2.1d">\mathbb{T}</annotation></semantics></math>, and the action, therefore, does not point to any cryptocurrency assets. Graph&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.F4.sf1" title="In Figure 4 ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">4(a)</span></a> has no arbitrage opportunity on the WBTC/ETH market (<math id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="0.0170\times 44.1488=0.75\leq 1" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1b"><mrow id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.cmml"><mrow id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml"><mn id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.2" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.2.cmml">0.0170</mn><mo lspace="0.222em" rspace="0.222em" id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.1" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.1.cmml">×</mo><mn id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.3" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.3.cmml">44.1488</mn></mrow><mo id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.3" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml">=</mo><mn id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.4" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.4.cmml">0.75</mn><mo id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.5" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.5.cmml">≤</mo><mn id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.6" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.6.cmml">1</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1c"><apply id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1"><and id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1a.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1"></and><apply id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1b.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1"><eq id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.3"></eq><apply id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2"><times id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.1"></times><cn type="float" id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.2">0.0170</cn><cn type="float" id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.3.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.2.3">44.1488</cn></apply><cn type="float" id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.4.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.4">0.75</cn></apply><apply id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1c.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1"><leq id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.5.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.5"></leq><share href="#S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.4.cmml" id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1d.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1"></share><cn type="integer" id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.6.cmml" xref="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1.1.6">1</cn></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.F4.7.3.m3.1d">0.0170\times 44.1488=0.75\leq 1</annotation></semantics></math>). In Graph&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.F4.sf2" title="In Figure 4 ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">4(b)</span></a> and&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.F4.sf3" title="In Figure 4 ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">4(c)</span></a>, the weights change (ETH/WBTC price) after the trader increases the flow (in ETH) to the bZx market because bZx’s price depends on the Uniswap price. The graph is hence dynamic&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib15" title="" class="ltx_ref">15</a>]</cite>, i.e., the weights need to be updated after each action. The action encoding of <span id="S5.F4.8.4.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> models the bZx’s price dependence on Uniswap. Note that the bZx attack does not violate <span id="S5.F4.8.4.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Heuristic 6</span>, because action <math id="S5.F4.8.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="1" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.F4.8.4.m4.1b"><mn id="S5.F4.8.4.m4.1.1" xref="S5.F4.8.4.m4.1.1.cmml">1</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.F4.8.4.m4.1c"><cn type="integer" id="S5.F4.8.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.F4.8.4.m4.1.1">1</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.F4.8.4.m4.1d">1</annotation></semantics></math> does not return any asset nor forms a sub-path (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A7.F15" title="Figure 15 ‣ Appendix G State Dependency ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">15</span></a>).</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<section id="S5.SS1" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S5.SS1.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">V-A</span> </span><span id="S5.SS1.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Choosing an SMT Solver for <span id="S5.SS1.6.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span></span>
</h3>

<div id="S5.SS1.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S5.SS1.p1.1" class="ltx_p">To overcome the aforementioned challenges of non-existent cycles, we chose to adopt a theorem prover for <span id="S5.SS1.p1.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span>’s (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S1.F1" title="Figure 1 ‣ I Introduction ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">1</span></a>) design. The theorem prover logically formulates what a profitable strategy entails to locate concrete profitable instantiations. We perform systematic path exploration to determine if the model (cf. Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3" title="III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">III</span></a>) satisfies the provided requirements, similar to other model checking systems&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib57" title="" class="ltx_ref">57</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib13" title="" class="ltx_ref">13</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib36" title="" class="ltx_ref">36</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib48" title="" class="ltx_ref">48</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib45" title="" class="ltx_ref">45</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib16" title="" class="ltx_ref">16</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib43" title="" class="ltx_ref">43</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib56" title="" class="ltx_ref">56</a>]</cite>.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS1.p2" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S5.SS1.p2.3" class="ltx_p">Our model requires the SMT solver (such as MathSat&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib14" title="" class="ltx_ref">14</a>]</cite>, Z3&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib21" title="" class="ltx_ref">21</a>]</cite>, or Coral&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib54" title="" class="ltx_ref">54</a>]</cite>) to support floating-point arithmetic because we adopt the theory of real numbers (cf. Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3" title="III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">III</span></a>). We encode the state transition model in three major steps: (i) Encode the initial state as a predicate; (ii) iteratively apply state transition actions, and encode the resulting states after each action as predicates. Then, (iii) convert the objective function into a set of constraints to ensure that the value of the trader portfolio increases by <math id="S5.SS1.p2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="Z" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS1.p2.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S5.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S5.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml">Z</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS1.p2.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S5.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1">𝑍</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS1.p2.1.m1.1c">Z</annotation></semantics></math>, and translate the constraints into predicates. Note that we rely on an optimization algorithm (cf. Algorithm&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#alg3" title="In Appendix F Optimizer for the SMT solver ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">3</span></a>) to find the highest possible <math id="S5.SS1.p2.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="Z" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS1.p2.2.m2.1a"><mi id="S5.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1" xref="S5.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml">Z</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS1.p2.2.m2.1b"><ci id="S5.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1">𝑍</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS1.p2.2.m2.1c">Z</annotation></semantics></math>. The optimization process requires solving the same SMT problem with different initializations of <math id="S5.SS1.p2.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="Z" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS1.p2.3.m3.1a"><mi id="S5.SS1.p2.3.m3.1.1" xref="S5.SS1.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml">Z</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS1.p2.3.m3.1b"><ci id="S5.SS1.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS1.p2.3.m3.1.1">𝑍</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS1.p2.3.m3.1c">Z</annotation></semantics></math> (cf.&nbsp;Appendix&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A3" title="Appendix C SMT encoding example ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">C</span></a> for an example).</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S5.SS2" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S5.SS2.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">V-B</span> </span><span id="S5.SS2.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Path Pruning</span>
</h3>

<div id="S5.SS2.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S5.SS2.p1.1" class="ltx_p">One bottleneck of model checking is the combinatorial path explosion problem. We, therefore, prune the paths by applying the following heuristics. Note that heuristics may prune profitable strategies, and <span id="S5.SS2.p1.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> is therefore only a best-effort tool.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS2.p2" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS2.p2.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS2.p2.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Heuristic 1:</span> A profitable strategy must consist of more than one action. That is because, given an initial state <math id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="S_{0}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1a"><msub id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml">S</mi><mn id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml">0</mn></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.2">𝑆</ci><cn type="integer" id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1.1.3">0</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p2.1.m1.1c">S_{0}</annotation></semantics></math>, a strategy with only one action will not increase the balance of the <em id="S5.SS2.p2.1.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> cryptocurrency asset while keeping the balance of all other cryptocurrency assets unchanged.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS2.p3" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS2.p3.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS2.p3.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Heuristic 2:</span> A strategy must start with a sequence of entering actions. An entering action is defined as any action which takes the <em id="S5.SS2.p3.1.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> cryptocurrency asset as input.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS2.p4" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS2.p4.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS2.p4.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Heuristic 3:</span> A strategy must end with a sequence of exiting actions. An exiting action is defined as any action that outputs the <em id="S5.SS2.p4.1.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> cryptocurrency asset. Recall that the objective of the trader is to maximize the amount of <em id="S5.SS2.p4.1.3" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> assets held.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS2.p5" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS2.p5.7" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS2.p5.7.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Heuristic 4:</span> Apart from the entering actions, an action must depend on at least one previous action. Conceptually, this is to avoid a strategy to contain actions that do not interact with any other actions. Given two actions <math id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{i},a_{j}\in A" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2a"><mrow id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.cmml"><mrow id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.3.cmml"><msub id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.3.cmml">i</mi></msub><mo id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><msub id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.2.cmml">a</mi><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.3.cmml">j</mi></msub></mrow><mo id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.3.cmml">∈</mo><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.4" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.4.cmml">A</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2b"><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2"><in id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.3"></in><list id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2"><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.2">𝑎</ci><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.1.1.3">𝑖</ci></apply><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.2">𝑎</ci><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.2.2.2.3">𝑗</ci></apply></list><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.4.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.4">𝐴</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p5.1.m1.2c">a_{i},a_{j}\in A</annotation></semantics></math>, we define that <math id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{i}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1a"><msub id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml">i</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1b"><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2">𝑎</ci><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3">𝑖</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p5.2.m2.1c">a_{i}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math id="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{j}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1a"><msub id="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml">j</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1b"><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" xref="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.3">𝑗</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p5.3.m3.1c">a_{j}</annotation></semantics></math> are independent actions, iff.&nbsp;there is no intersection between <math id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a_{i})" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1a"><mrow id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.cmml"><msup id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.3.cmml"><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic" id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.3.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.1.1.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.1.1.cmml">(</mo><msub id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2"></times><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.3"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.3.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.1.1.3">𝑖</ci></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p5.4.m4.1c">\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a_{i})</annotation></semantics></math> and <math id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a_{j})" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1a"><mrow id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.1.1.1.cmml">(</mo><msub id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.1.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.1.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.1.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.1.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.1.1.1.3.cmml">j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false" id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.1.1.1.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1b"><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1"><times id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.2"></times><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.3"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.3.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1.1.1.1.1.3">𝑗</ci></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p5.5.m5.1c">\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a_{j})</annotation></semantics></math> (cf. Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.E8" title="In V-B Path Pruning ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">8</span></a>). In other words, the execution of <math id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{i}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1a"><msub id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.3.cmml">i</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1b"><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.2">𝑎</ci><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1.1.3">𝑖</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p5.6.m6.1c">a_{i}</annotation></semantics></math> does not affect the execution results of <math id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{j}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1a"><msub id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.3.cmml">j</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1b"><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.2">𝑎</ci><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1.1.3">𝑗</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p5.7.m7.1c">a_{j}</annotation></semantics></math>, no matter what concrete state is given.</p>

<td class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_eqn_center_padleft"></td>
<td class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_align_center"><math id="S5.E8.m1.1" class="ltx_math_unparsed" alttext="{a_{i}}\perp\!\!\!\perp{a_{j}}\iff\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a_{i})\cap\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a_{j})=\emptyset" display="block"><semantics id="S5.E8.m1.1a"><mrow id="S5.E8.m1.1b"><msub id="S5.E8.m1.1.1"><mi id="S5.E8.m1.1.1.2">a</mi><mi id="S5.E8.m1.1.1.3">i</mi></msub><mpadded width="0.250em" id="S5.E8.m1.1c"><mo id="S5.E8.m1.1.2">⟂</mo></mpadded><mo id="S5.E8.m1.1.3">⟂</mo><msub id="S5.E8.m1.1.4"><mi id="S5.E8.m1.1.4.2">a</mi><mi id="S5.E8.m1.1.4.3">j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false" id="S5.E8.m1.1.5">⇔</mo><msup id="S5.E8.m1.1.6"><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic" id="S5.E8.m1.1.6.2">𝒦</mi><mi id="S5.E8.m1.1.6.3">𝕋</mi></msup><mrow id="S5.E8.m1.1.7"><mo stretchy="false" id="S5.E8.m1.1.7.1">(</mo><msub id="S5.E8.m1.1.7.2"><mi id="S5.E8.m1.1.7.2.2">a</mi><mi id="S5.E8.m1.1.7.2.3">i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false" id="S5.E8.m1.1.7.3">)</mo></mrow><mo id="S5.E8.m1.1.8">∩</mo><msup id="S5.E8.m1.1.9"><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic" id="S5.E8.m1.1.9.2">𝒦</mi><mi id="S5.E8.m1.1.9.3">𝕋</mi></msup><mrow id="S5.E8.m1.1.10"><mo stretchy="false" id="S5.E8.m1.1.10.1">(</mo><msub id="S5.E8.m1.1.10.2"><mi id="S5.E8.m1.1.10.2.2">a</mi><mi id="S5.E8.m1.1.10.2.3">j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false" id="S5.E8.m1.1.10.3">)</mo></mrow><mo id="S5.E8.m1.1.11">=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal" id="S5.E8.m1.1.12">∅</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.E8.m1.1d">{a_{i}}\perp\!\!\!\perp{a_{j}}\iff\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a_{i})\cap\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a_{j})=\emptyset</annotation></semantics></math></td>

<p id="S5.SS2.p5.31" class="ltx_p">Recall that <math id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{K}(a)" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1a"><mrow id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.cmml"><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic" id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.2.cmml">𝒦</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.1.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.3.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.3.2.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.cmml">(</mo><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.1.cmml">a</mi><mo stretchy="false" id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.3.2.2" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1b"><apply id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2"><times id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.1"></times><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.2.2">𝒦</ci><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1.1">𝑎</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p5.8.m1.1c">\mathcal{K}(a)</annotation></semantics></math> denotes the set of smart contract storage variables an action <math id="S5.SS2.p5.9.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p5.9.m2.1a"><mi id="S5.SS2.p5.9.m2.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p5.9.m2.1.1.cmml">a</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p5.9.m2.1b"><ci id="S5.SS2.p5.9.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p5.9.m2.1.1">𝑎</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p5.9.m2.1c">a</annotation></semantics></math> reads from and writes to, and <math id="S5.SS2.p5.10.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a)" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p5.10.m3.1a"><mrow id="S5.SS2.p5.10.m3.1.2" <div id="S5.SS2.p6" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS2.p6.7" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS2.p6.7.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Heuristic 5:</span> An action cannot be immediately followed by another reversing action (i.e., a mirroring action) on the same DeFi market. For instance, if <math id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{1}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1a"><msub id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mn id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml">1</mn></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.2">𝑎</ci><cn type="integer" id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1.1.3">1</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p6.1.m1.1c">a_{1}</annotation></semantics></math> transacts <math id="S5.SS2.p6.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{1}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p6.2.m2.1a"><msub id="S5.SS2.p6.2.m2.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p6.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p6.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p6.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mn id="S5.SS2.p6.2.m2.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p6.2.m2.1.1.3">1</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p6.2.m2.1c">c_{1}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math id="S5.SS2.p6.3.m3.1" id="S5.SS2.p6.5.m5.1c">c_{2}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math id="S5.SS2.p6.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{1}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p6.6.m6.1a"><msub will prune all paths that contain <math id="S5.SS2.p6.7.m7.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{1},a_{2}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p6.7.m7.2a"><mrow id="S5.SS2.p6.7.m7.2.2.2" xref="S5.SS2.p6.7.m7.2.2.2.2.3.cmml">2</mn></msub></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p6.7.m7.2b"><list id="S5.SS2.p6.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p6.7.m7.2.2.2"><apply id="S5.SS2.p7.3.m3.1c">[c_{1}\xrightarrow{a_{3}}c_{3}\xrightarrow{a_{4}}c_{4}\xrightarrow{a_{5}}c_{1}]</annotation></semantics></math> (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.F5.sf1" title="In Figure 5 ‣ V-B Path Pruning ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">5(a)</span></a>). In our work, we choose the more profitable path, and discard the other, because both paths affect the asset <math id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{4}" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1a"><msub id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1" xref="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.2" xref="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mn id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.3.cmml">4</mn></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1b"><apply id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><cn type="integer" id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.3">4</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p7.4.m4.1c">c_{4}</annotation></semantics></math>. In a future work, it might be interesting to attempt to extract profit from both paths in an effort to maximize the revenue.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS2.p8" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS2.p8.5" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS2.p8.5.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Heuristic 7:</span> A path must not include any loops. For example, a path <math id="S5.SS2.p8.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="[c_{1}\xrightarrow{a_{1}}c_{2}\xrightarrow{a_{2}}c_{3}\xrightarrow{a_{3}}c_{2}\xrightarrow{a_{4}}c_{3}\xrightarrow{a_{5}}c_{1}]" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS2.p8.1.m1.1a"><mrow xref="S5.SS2.p8.1.m1.1.1.1.1.3.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mn id="S5.SS2.p8.1.m1.1.1.1.1.3.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p8.1.m1.1.1.1.1.3.1.3.cmml">1</mn></msub></mover><msub id="S5.SS2.p8.1.m1.1.1.1.1.4" xref="S5.SS2.p8.1.m1.1.1.1.1.5.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mn id="S5.SS2.p8.1.m1.1.1.1.1.5.1.3" xref="S5.SS2.p8.1.m1.1.1.1.1.5.1.3.cmml">2</mn></msub></mover><msub id="S5.SS2.p8.1.m1.1.1.1.1.6" id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.5.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.5.1.3">4</cn></apply><ci id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.5.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.5.2">→</ci></apply><share href="#S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.4.cmml" id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1d.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1"></share><apply id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.6.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.6"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.6.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.6">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.6.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.6.2">𝑐</ci><cn type="integer" id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.6.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.6.3">3</cn></apply></apply><apply id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1e.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1"><apply id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7"><apply id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.1.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.1.2">𝑎</ci><cn type="integer" id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.1.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.1.3">5</cn></apply><ci id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.7.2">→</ci></apply><share href="#S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.6.cmml" id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1f.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1"></share><apply id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.8.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.8"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.8.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.8">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.8.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.8.2">𝑐</ci><cn type="integer" id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.8.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1.1.1.1.8.3">1</cn></apply></apply></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS2.p8.5.m5.1c">[c_{1}\xrightarrow{a_{1}}c_{2}\xrightarrow{a_{4}}c_{3}\xrightarrow{a_{5}}c_{1}]</annotation></semantics></math> (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.F5.sf2" title="In Figure 5 ‣ V-B Path Pruning ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">5(b)</span></a>). We again chose the more profitable path, and discard the other for simplicity. We leave it to future work to optimize the potential gain.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS2.p9" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S5.SS2.p9.1" class="ltx_p">The efficiency of path pruning can be evaluated across two dimensions: <em id="S5.SS2.p9.1.1" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">(i)</em> the number of paths that are pruned, and, <em id="S5.SS2.p9.1.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">(ii)</em> the reduction in revenue resulting from the heuristic pruning. To address the former, we show the reduction of the number of paths due to the heuristics in Table&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.T2" title="TABLE II ‣ VI-B DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">II</span></a> and discuss these results further in Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.SS2" title="VI-B DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag"><span class="ltx_text">VI-B</span></span></a>. Regarding the latter, because we cannot quantify the optimal revenue due to the combinatorial explosion of the search space, we, unfortunately, see no avenue to quantify the reduction in revenue caused by the heuristics.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S5.SS3" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S5.SS3.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">V-C</span> </span><span id="S5.SS3.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT<span id="S5.SS3.6.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic"> Revenue Optimizer</span></span>
</h3>

<div id="S5.SS3.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S5.SS3.p1.1" class="ltx_p">SMT solvers validate if any initialization of the free variables would satisfy the requirements defined. One requirement we specify is to increase the <em id="S5.SS3.p1.1.1" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> cryptocurrency asset balance by a fixed amount. To find the maximum satisfiable revenue, we chose to use the following optimization algorithm (cf.&nbsp;Algorithm&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#alg3" title="In Appendix F Optimizer for the SMT solver ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">3</span></a>). At a high level, to identify a coarse upper and lower revenue bound, this algorithm first attempts to solve, given multiples of&nbsp;10 for the trader revenue. Given these bounds, we perform a binary search to find the optimal value.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S5.SS4" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S5.SS4.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">V-D</span> </span><span id="S5.SS4.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Comparing <span id="S5.SS4.6.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> to <span id="S5.SS4.6.2.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span></span>
</h3>

<div id="S5.SS4.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S5.SS4.p1.1" class="ltx_p">Table&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.T1" title="TABLE I ‣ V-D Comparing DeFiPoser-SMT to DeFiPoser-ARB ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">I</span></a> summarizes our comparison between <span id="S5.SS4.p1.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> and <span id="S5.SS4.p1.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>. While arbitrage opportunities appear plentiful, <span id="S5.SS4.p1.1.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> cannot capture non-cyclic transactions such as the bZx case. Because <span id="S5.SS4.p1.1.4" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> can encode any arbitrary strategy as an SMT problem, we argue that it is a more generic tool, as long as the underlying SMT solver can find a solution fast enough. We would like to stress again that both tools <span id="S5.SS4.p1.1.5" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> and <span id="S5.SS4.p1.1.6" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> do not provide optimal solutions. <span id="S5.SS4.p1.1.7" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> greedily searches for arbitrage and extracts revenue as each opportunity arises. To show that <span id="S5.SS4.p1.1.8" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> does not find optimal solutions, we provide the following example at block <math id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="9,819,643" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3a"><mrow id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.4.2" xref="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml"><mn id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">9</mn><mo id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.4.2.1" xref="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.2.2" xref="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.2.2.cmml">819</mn><mo id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.4.2.2" xref="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.3" xref="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.3.cmml">643</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3b"><list id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.4.2"><cn type="integer" id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.1.1">9</cn><cn type="integer" id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.2.2.cmml" xref="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.2.2">819</cn><cn type="integer" id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.3.cmml" xref="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3.3">643</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS4.p1.1.m1.3c">9,819,643</annotation></semantics></math>. Here, <span id="S5.SS4.p1.1.9" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> finds two opportunities:</p>
<dl id="S5.I1" class="ltx_description">
<dt id="S5.I1.ix1" class="ltx_item"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_item"><span id="S5.I1.ix1.1.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Strategy 1</span></span></dt>
<dd class="ltx_item">
<div id="S5.I1.ix1.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S5.I1.ix1.p1.2" class="ltx_p"><math id="S5.I1.ix1.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="[ETH\xrightarrow{Bancor}BNT\xrightarrow{Bancor}MKR\xrightarrow{Uniswap}ETH]" display="inline"><semantics
