xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.9.1.7">𝑎</ci><ci id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.9.1.8.cmml" xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.9.1.8">𝑝</ci></apply><ci id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.9.2.cmml" xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.9.2">→</ci></apply><share href="#S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.8.cmml" id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1h.cmml" xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1"></share><apply id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.10.cmml" xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.10"><times id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.10.1.cmml" xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.10.1"></times><ci id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.10.2.cmml" xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.10.2">𝐸</ci><ci id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.10.3.cmml" xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.10.3">𝑇</ci><ci id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.10.4.cmml" xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1.10.4">𝐻</ci></apply></apply></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.1.m1.1c">[ETH\xrightarrow{Uniswap}BAT\xrightarrow{Bancor}BNT\xrightarrow{Bancor}MKR\xrightarrow{Uniswap}ETH]</annotation></semantics></math> with <math id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="0.11" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">0.11</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.2.m2.1b"><cn type="float" id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.2.m2.1.1">0.11</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.2.m2.1c">0.11</annotation></semantics></math> ETH of revenue.</p>
</div>
</dd>
</dl>
<p id="S5.SS4.p1.3" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS4.p1.3.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> will only execute strategy 1. <span id="S5.SS4.p1.3.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>, however, finds and executes strategy 2 first to extract <math id="S5.SS4.p1.2.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="0.11" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS4.p1.2.m1.1a"><mn id="S5.SS4.p1.2.m1.1.1" xref="S5.SS4.p1.2.m1.1.1.cmml">0.11</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS4.p1.2.m1.1b"><cn type="float" id="S5.SS4.p1.2.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS4.p1.2.m1.1.1">0.11</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS4.p1.2.m1.1c">0.11</annotation></semantics></math> ETH. After executing strategy 2 and updating the graph, strategy 1 is no longer profitable. Therefore, <span id="S5.SS4.p1.3.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> only extracts a revenue of <math id="S5.SS4.p1.3.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="0.11" display="inline"><semantics id="S5.SS4.p1.3.m2.1a"><mn id="S5.SS4.p1.3.m2.1.1" xref="S5.SS4.p1.3.m2.1.1.cmml">0.11</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S5.SS4.p1.3.m2.1b"><cn type="float" id="S5.SS4.p1.3.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S5.SS4.p1.3.m2.1.1">0.11</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S5.SS4.p1.3.m2.1c">0.11</annotation></semantics></math> ETH in this block. Note that <span id="S5.SS4.p1.3.4" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> provides proof of satisfiable/unsatisfiable revenue targets for each considered path. However, <span id="S5.SS4.p1.3.5" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> remains a best-effort tool because the heuristics prune paths that may be profitable. Contrary to <span id="S5.SS4.p1.3.6" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>, <span id="S5.SS4.p1.3.7" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> does not merge paths.</p>
</div>

<td id="S5.T1.11.11.15.4.2" class="ltx_td ltx_align_justify ltx_align_top">
<span id="S5.T1.11.11.15.4.2.1" class="ltx_inline-block ltx_align_top">

</table>
</span></div>
<figcaption class="ltx_caption ltx_centering"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_table"><span id="S5.T1.15.1.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">TABLE I</span>: </span><span id="S5.T1.16.2" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">High-level comparison between <span id="S5.T1.16.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> and <span id="S5.T1.16.2.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span>.</span></figcaption>
</figure>
</section>
<section id="S5.SS5" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S5.SS5.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">V-E</span> </span><span id="S5.SS5.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Limitations</span>
</h3>

<div id="S5.SS5.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S5.SS5.p1.1" class="ltx_p">We elaborate on a few limitations of our work.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS5.p2" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS5.p2.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS5.p2.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">State dependency:</span>
In this study, we focus on block-level state dependencies (cf.&nbsp;Appendix&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A7" title="Appendix G State Dependency ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">G</span></a>), i.e., we consider a state to only change when a new block is mined. In practice, a DeFi state can change several times within the same blockchain block (as several transactions can trade on a DeFi platform within a block). Our assumption hence may cause us to not consider potentially profitable trades. An alternative approach to study state dependency, which we leave to future work, is to perform a transaction-level analysis. Such an analysis would assume that the trader observes the peer-to-peer network layer of the Ethereum network. Based on the information of transactions in the memory pool (the pool of unconfirmed transactions), the transaction order and state changes in the next block could be estimated ahead of the block being mined.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS5.p3" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS5.p3.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS5.p3.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Scalability:</span>
One problem of <span id="S5.SS5.p3.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span> is the combinatorial path explosion. To mitigate this problem, heuristics reduce the path space, which only needs to be executed once. For every new block, <span id="S5.SS5.p3.1.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span> can parallelize the parameter search process to find the most profitable paths. A limitation of negative cycle detection is that it has to search for negative cycles before starting to search parameters. The graph needs to be updated after executing every strategy. This is difficult to parallelize and limits the system’s real-time capability, especially when there are multiple negative cycles, or the cycle length is long.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS5.p4" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS5.p4.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS5.p4.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Manual Modeling and Code Complexity:</span>
<span id="S5.SS5.p4.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> only needs to be aware of the spot price of each market and treats the underlying smart contracts and exchange protocols as a black box while greedily exploring opportunities. <span id="S5.SS5.p4.1.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span>, however, requires the manual translation of the objective function into an SMT problem. This requires to encode the state transitions into a group of predicates (cf.&nbsp;Appendix&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A3" title="Appendix C SMT encoding example ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">C</span></a>). The modeling process not only increases the code complexity (cf.&nbsp;Table&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.T1" title="TABLE I ‣ V-D Comparing DeFiPoser-SMT to DeFiPoser-ARB ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">I</span></a>) but also causes inaccuracies in the found solutions and therefore requires a validation process through, e.g., concrete execution.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS5.p5" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS5.p5.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS5.p5.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Approximated Revenue:</span>
To avoid double-counting revenue when a profitable path exists over multiple blocks, we apply a state dependency analysis and only exploit paths with a state change (cf.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A7" title="Appendix G State Dependency ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">G</span></a>). However, <span id="S5.SS5.p5.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span>’s reported revenue is not accurate because: (i) We work on historical blockchain states. In practice, the profitability of <span id="S5.SS5.p5.1.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span> will be affected by the underlying blockchain’s network layer; (ii) For simplicity within this work, we assume that <span id="S5.SS5.p5.1.4" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span> does not change other market participants’ behavior. In practice, other traders are likely to monitor our activity and adjust their trading strategy accordingly.</p>
</div>
<div id="S5.SS5.p6" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S5.SS5.p6.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S5.SS5.p6.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Multiple Traders:</span>

Within this work, we only consider a single trader using <span id="S5.SS5.p6.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span>. Zhou&nbsp;<span id="S5.SS5.p6.1.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">et al.</span>&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib61" title="" class="ltx_ref">61</a>]</cite> simulated the outcome of competing transactions from several traders under a reactive counter-bidding strategy. We believe that those results translate over to MEV when multiple traders (specifically non-miners) compete over <span id="S5.SS5.p6.1.4" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span> transactions. Zhou&nbsp;<span id="S5.SS5.p6.1.5" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">et al.</span>&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib61" title="" class="ltx_ref">61</a>]</cite>’s results suggest that the total revenue will be divided among the competing traders.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<section id="S6" class="ltx_section">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_title_section">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_section">VI </span><span id="S6.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">Experimental Evaluation</span>
</h2>

<div id="S6.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S6.p1.9" class="ltx_p">To query the Ethereum blockchain, we set up a full archive Geth<span id="footnote1" class="ltx_note ltx_role_footnote"><sup class="ltx_note_mark">1</sup><span class="ltx_note_outer"><span class="ltx_note_content"><sup class="ltx_note_mark">1</sup><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_note">1</span><a target="_blank" href="https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum" title="" class="ltx_ref ltx_url ltx_font_typewriter">https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum</a></span></span></span> node (i.e., a node which stores all intermediate blockchain state transitions) on a
AMD Ryzen Threadripper <math id="S6.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="3990" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p1.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S6.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">3990</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p1.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p1.1.m1.1.1">3990</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p1.1.m1.1c">3990</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;X Processor (<math id="S6.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="4.3" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p1.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S6.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">4.3</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p1.2.m2.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p1.2.m2.1.1">4.3</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p1.2.m2.1c">4.3</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;GHz,&nbsp;<math id="S6.p1.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="64" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p1.3.m3.1a"><mn id="S6.p1.3.m3.1.1" xref="S6.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml">64</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p1.3.m3.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p1.3.m3.1.1">64</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p1.3.m3.1c">64</annotation></semantics></math> cores), <math id="S6.p1.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="4" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p1.4.m4.1a"><mn id="S6.p1.4.m4.1.1" xref="S6.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml">4</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p1.4.m4.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p1.4.m4.1.1">4</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p1.4.m4.1c">4</annotation></semantics></math>x<math id="S6.p1.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="2" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p1.5.m5.1a"><mn id="S6.p1.5.m5.1.1" xref="S6.p1.5.m5.1.1.cmml">2</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p1.5.m5.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.p1.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p1.5.m5.1.1">2</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p1.5.m5.1c">2</annotation></semantics></math> TB NVMe SSD RAID <math id="S6.p1.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="0" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p1.6.m6.1a"><mn id="S6.p1.6.m6.1.1" xref="S6.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml">0</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p1.6.m6.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p1.6.m6.1.1">0</cn></annotation-xml></semantics></math> and <math id="S6.p1.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="256" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p1.7.m7.1a"><mn id="S6.p1.7.m7.1.1" xref="S6.p1.7.m7.1.1.cmml">256</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p1.7.m7.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.p1.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p1.7.m7.1.1">256</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p1.7.m7.1c">256</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;GB RAM.
We perform the concrete execution with a custom py-evm<span id="footnote2" class="ltx_note ltx_role_footnote"><sup class="ltx_note_mark">2</sup><span class="ltx_note_outer"><span class="ltx_note_content"><sup class="ltx_note_mark">2</sup><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_note">2</span><a target="_blank" href="https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm" title="" class="ltx_ref ltx_url ltx_font_typewriter">https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm</a></span></span></span>, which can fork the Ethereum blockchain at any given block height. To simplify our experimental complexity, we do not consider trades which yield below&nbsp;<math id="S6.p1.8.m8.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{0.10}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p1.8.m8.1a"><mn id="S6.p1.8.m8.1.1" xref="S6.p1.8.m8.1.1.cmml">0.10</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p1.8.m8.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.p1.8.m8.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p1.8.m8.1.1">0.10</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p1.8.m8.1c">\numprint{0.10}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S6.p1.9.m9.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{40}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p1.9.m9.1a"><mn id="S6.p1.9.m9.1.1" xref="S6.p1.9.m9.1.1.cmml">40</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p1.9.m9.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.p1.9.m9.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p1.9.m9.1.1">40</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p1.9.m9.1c">\numprint{40}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) and are aware that this potentially reduces the resulting financial gain.</p>
</div>
<div id="S6.p2" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S6.p2.4" class="ltx_p">We select&nbsp;<math id="S6.p2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="96" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p2.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S6.p2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml">96</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p2.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p2.1.m1.1.1">96</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p2.1.m1.1c">96</annotation></semantics></math> actions from the Uniswap, Bancor, and MakerDAO, with a total of&nbsp;<math id="S6.p2.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="25" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p2.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S6.p2.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml">25</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p2.2.m2.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p2.2.m2.1.1">25</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p2.2.m2.1c">25</annotation></semantics></math> assets (cf.&nbsp;Table&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A1.T3" title="TABLE III ‣ Appendix A Summary of the ERC-20 cryptocurrency assets ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">III</span></a> and&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A2.T4" title="TABLE IV ‣ Appendix B Supported DeFi actions ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">IV</span></a> in Appendix). To enable action chaining, all considered assets trade on Uniswap and Bancor, while SAI and DAI are convertible on MakerDAO. The total value of assets on the three platforms sums up to&nbsp;<math id="S6.p2.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="3.3" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p2.3.m3.1a"><mn id="S6.p2.3.m3.1.1" xref="S6.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml">3.3</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p2.3.m3.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p2.3.m3.1.1">3.3</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p2.3.m3.1c">3.3</annotation></semantics></math> billion USD, which corresponds to&nbsp;<math id="S6.p2.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="82\%" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.p2.4.m4.1a"><mrow id="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1" xref="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1.2" xref="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml">82</mn><mo id="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1.1" xref="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1.1.cmml">%</mo></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.p2.4.m4.1b"><apply id="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1.1">percent</csymbol><cn type="integer" id="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.p2.4.m4.1.1.2">82</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.p2.4.m4.1c">82\%</annotation></semantics></math> of the total USD value locked in DeFi as of May&nbsp;2020.</p>
</div>
<div id="S6.p3" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S6.p3.1" class="ltx_p">Both <span id="S6.p3.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> and <span id="S6.p3.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> apply dependency-based state reduction. Stationary blockchain states are identified and skipped to avoid redundant computation and double counting of revenue.</p>
</div>
<section id="S6.SS1" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S6.SS1.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">VI-A</span> </span><span id="S6.SS1.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>
</h3>

<div id="S6.SS1.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S6.SS1.p1.11" class="ltx_p">We translate the&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS1.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="25" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S6.SS1.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">25</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS1.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.1.m1.1.1">25</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS1.p1.1.m1.1c">25</annotation></semantics></math> assets and &nbsp;<math id="S6.SS1.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="96" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S6.SS1.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">96</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.2.m2.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS1.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.2.m2.1.1">96</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS1.p1.2.m2.1c">96</annotation></semantics></math> actions into a graph with&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS1.p1.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="25" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.3.m3.1a"><mn id="S6.SS1.p1.3.m3.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml">25</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.3.m3.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS1.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.3.m3.1.1">25</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS1.p1.3.m3.1c">25</annotation></semantics></math> nodes and&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS1.p1.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="94" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.4.m4.1a"><mn id="S6.SS1.p1.4.m4.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml">94</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.4.m4.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS1.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.4.m4.1.1">94</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS1.p1.4.m4.1c">94</annotation></semantics></math> edges. Each node in the graph represents a cryptocurrency asset. For each edge <math id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="e_{i,j}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2a"><msub id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.3" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.3.cmml"><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.3.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.3.2.cmml">e</mi><mrow id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.4" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.3.cmml"><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.1.1.1.1.cmml">i</mi><mo id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.4.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.2.cmml">j</mi></mrow></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2b"><apply id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.3"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.3">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.3.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.3.2">𝑒</ci><list id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.4"><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.1.1.1.1">𝑖</ci><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.2">𝑗</ci></list></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS1.p1.5.m5.2c">e_{i,j}</annotation></semantics></math> pointing from asset <math id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{i}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1a"><msub id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.3.cmml">i</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1b"><apply id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1.1.3">𝑖</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS1.p1.6.m6.1c">c_{i}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{j}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1a"><msub id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.3.cmml">j</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1b"><apply id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1.1.3">𝑗</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS1.p1.7.m7.1c">c_{j}</annotation></semantics></math>, we find all markets with asset <math id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{i}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1a"><msub id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.3.cmml">i</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1b"><apply id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1.1.3">𝑖</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS1.p1.8.m8.1c">c_{i}</annotation></semantics></math> as input, and output asset <math id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{j}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1a"><msub id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.2.cmml">c</mi><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.3.cmml">j</mi></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1b"><apply id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1.1.3">𝑗</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS1.p1.9.m9.1c">c_{j}</annotation></semantics></math>. Each edge’s weight is derived using the highest price found among all supporting markets, or <math id="S6.SS1.p1.10.m10.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="0" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.10.m10.1a"><mn id="S6.SS1.p1.10.m10.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.10.m10.1.1.cmml">0</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.10.m10.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS1.p1.10.m10.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.10.m10.1.1">0</cn></annotation-xml></semantics></math> if there is no market. We then follow Algorithm&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#alg1" title="In IV-B Negative Cycle Detection Algorithms ‣ IV Applying Negative Cycle Detection to DeFi Arbitrage ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">1</span></a> to greedily extract arbitrage revenue as soon as one negative cycle is found. We use the BFCF (Bellman-Ford-Moore, Walk to the root) algorithm to find negative cycles, which operates in <math id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="O(|N^{2}|\cdot|E|)" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.cmml"><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.3" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.3.cmml">O</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.2.cmml">​</mo><mrow id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.cmml">(</mo><mrow id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.cmml"><mrow id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.2.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.2.1.cmml">|</mo><msup id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.2.cmml">N</mi><mn id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.cmml">2</mn></msup><mo rspace="0.055em" stretchy="false" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.2.1.cmml">|</mo></mrow><mo rspace="0.222em" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.2.cmml">⋅</mo><mrow id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.3.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.3.1.cmml"><mo stretchy="false" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.3.2.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.3.1.1.cmml">|</mo><mi id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.1.1" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.1.1.cmml">E</mi><mo stretchy="false" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.3.2.2" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.3.1.1.cmml">|</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.cmml">)</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2b"><apply id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2"><times id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.2"></times><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.3">𝑂</ci><apply id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1"><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.2">⋅</ci><apply id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1"><abs id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.2"></abs><apply id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1">superscript</csymbol><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.2">𝑁</ci><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.1.1.1.3">2</cn></apply></apply><apply id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.3.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.3.2"><abs id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.3.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2.2.1.1.1.3.2.1"></abs><ci id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.1.1">𝐸</ci></apply></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS1.p1.11.m11.2c">O(|N^{2}|\cdot|E|)</annotation></semantics></math>. For each arbitrage opportunity, <span id="S6.SS1.p1.11.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> gradually increases the input parameter (amount of <em id="S6.SS1.p1.11.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> cryptocurrency asset) until the revenue ceases to increase.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S6.SS2" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S6.SS2.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">VI-B</span> </span><span id="S6.SS2.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span>
</h3>

<div id="S6.SS2.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S6.SS2.p1.1" class="ltx_p">We translate DeFi states into Z3&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib21" title="" class="ltx_ref">21</a>]</cite> as constraints on state symbolic variables (cf.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S3" title="III DeFi Modeling ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">III</span></a>). We symbolically encode all variables using floats instead of integers because the EVM only supports integers. Most DeFi smart contracts express floats as integers by multiplying floats with a large factor. Division and power are, therefore, estimated using integer math. This practice may introduce a bias in our state and transition functions. Due to such model inaccuracies, we proceed to concrete execution (i.e., real-world smart contract execution on the EVM) to avoid false positives and validate our result.</p>
</div>
<div id="S6.SS2.p2" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S6.SS2.p2.1" class="ltx_p">An exhaustive search over the total action space is infeasible. Therefore, we apply path pruning (cf. Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.SS2" title="V-B Path Pruning ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag"><span class="ltx_text">V-B</span></span></a>) to discard irrelevant paths.</p>
</div>
<div id="S6.SS2.p3" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S6.SS2.p3.8" class="ltx_p"><span id="S6.SS2.p3.8.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Path Discovery and Pruning:</span>
The&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS2.p3.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="96" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p3.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S6.SS2.p3.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml">96</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p3.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS2.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.1.m1.1.1">96</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p3.1.m1.1c">96</annotation></semantics></math> DeFi actions (cf.&nbsp;Table&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A2.T4" title="TABLE IV ‣ Appendix B Supported DeFi actions ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">IV</span></a> in Appendix) result in&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="9.92\times 10^{149}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1a"><mrow id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml">9.92</mn><mo lspace="0.222em" rspace="0.222em" id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml">×</mo><msup id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.2" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.2.cmml">10</mn><mn id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.3" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.3.cmml">149</mn></msup></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1b"><apply id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1"><times id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.1"></times><cn type="float" id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.2">9.92</cn><apply id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3">superscript</csymbol><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.2">10</cn><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1.1.3.3">149</cn></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p3.2.m2.1c">9.92\times 10^{149}</annotation></semantics></math> possible paths without repeating actions, which is an impractical space to evaluate. Table&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.T2" title="TABLE II ‣ VI-B DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">II</span></a> hence illustrates the impact of our heuristics on paths of various lengths. We observe a significant reduction of at least&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="99.98\%" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1a"><mrow id="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml">99.98</mn><mo id="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml">%</mo></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1b"><apply id="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1.1">percent</csymbol><cn type="float" id="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1.1.2">99.98</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p3.3.m3.1c">99.98\%</annotation></semantics></math> per path length of the total number of considered paths, resulting in only&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS2.p3.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="600" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p3.4.m4.1a"><mn id="S6.SS2.p3.4.m4.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.4.m4.1.1.cmml">600</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p3.4.m4.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS2.p3.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.4.m4.1.1">600</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p3.4.m4.1c">600</annotation></semantics></math> remaining paths. The majority of paths&nbsp;(<math id="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="77.67\%" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1a"><mrow id="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1.2.cmml">77.67</mn><mo id="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1.1.cmml">%</mo></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1b"><apply id="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1.1">percent</csymbol><cn type="float" id="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1.1.2">77.67</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p3.5.m5.1c">77.67\%</annotation></semantics></math>) consist of&nbsp;4 actions, while the shortest paths count&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS2.p3.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="2" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p3.6.m6.1a"><mn id="S6.SS2.p3.6.m6.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.6.m6.1.1.cmml">2</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p3.6.m6.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS2.p3.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.6.m6.1.1">2</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p3.6.m6.1c">2</annotation></semantics></math> actions, and the longest&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS2.p3.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="5" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p3.7.m7.1a"><mn id="S6.SS2.p3.7.m7.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.7.m7.1.1.cmml">5</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p3.7.m7.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS2.p3.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.7.m7.1.1">5</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p3.7.m7.1c">5</annotation></semantics></math> actions. Although we do not enforce a constraint on the maximum number of actions, all paths with more than&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS2.p3.8.m8.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="5" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p3.8.m8.1a"><mn id="S6.SS2.p3.8.m8.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p3.8.m8.1.1.cmml">5</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p3.8.m8.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS2.p3.8.m8.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p3.8.m8.1.1">5</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p3.8.m8.1c">5</annotation></semantics></math> actions failed to pass our heuristics.</p>
</div>

</tbody>
</table>
<figcaption class="ltx_caption ltx_centering"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_table"><span id="S6.T2.18.4.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">TABLE II</span>: </span><span id="S6.T2.16.3" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">
Results of path pruning after applying the heuristics from Section&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S5.SS2" title="V-B Path Pruning ‣ V Design of DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag"><span class="ltx_text">V-B</span></span></a>. In total,&nbsp;<math id="S6.T2.14.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="600" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.T2.14.1.m1.1b"><mn id="S6.T2.14.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.T2.14.1.m1.1.1.cmml">600</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.T2.14.1.m1.1c"><cn type="integer" id="S6.T2.14.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.T2.14.1.m1.1.1">600</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.T2.14.1.m1.1d">600</annotation></semantics></math> paths remain, with the majority&nbsp;(<math id="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="77.67\%" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1b"><mrow id="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml">77.67</mn><mo id="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1.1" xref="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml">%</mo></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1c"><apply id="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1.1">percent</csymbol><cn type="float" id="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1.1.2">77.67</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.T2.15.2.m2.1d">77.67\%</annotation></semantics></math>) consisting of&nbsp;4 actions. For each path length, the heuristics remove at least&nbsp;<math id="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="99.98\%" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1b"><mrow id="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1" xref="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1.2" xref="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml">99.98</mn><mo id="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1.1" xref="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml">%</mo></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1c"><apply id="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1.1">percent</csymbol><cn type="float" id="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1.1.2">99.98</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.T2.16.3.m3.1d">99.98\%</annotation></semantics></math> of the strategies.</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<div id="S6.SS2.p4" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S6.SS2.p4.2" class="ltx_p"><span id="S6.SS2.p4.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Action Dependency:</span>
In the following, we present a concrete example of determining the dependency between two actions. The first action <math id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{\text{Uniswap}}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1a"><msub id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mtext id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.3a.cmml">Uniswap</mtext></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.2">𝑎</ci><ci id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.3a.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.3"><mtext mathsize="70%" id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1.3">Uniswap</mtext></ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p4.1.m1.1c">a_{\text{Uniswap}}</annotation></semantics></math> transacts ETH to SAI using the Uniswap SAI market. The second action <math id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{\text{Bancor}}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1a"><msub id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml">a</mi><mtext id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.3a.cmml">Bancor</mtext></msub><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1b"><apply id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.2">𝑎</ci><ci id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.3a.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.3"><mtext mathsize="70%" id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.3">Bancor</mtext></ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p4.2.m2.1c">a_{\text{Bancor}}</annotation></semantics></math> transacts BNT to SAI using the Bancor SAI contract. Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.E10" title="In VI-B DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">10</span></a> and Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.E11" title="In VI-B DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">11</span></a> show the relevant storage variables, respectively. These two actions are not independent, as they both modify the trader’s balance in the SAI contract.</p>

<td class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_eqn_center_padleft"></td>
<td class="ltx_td ltx_align_right ltx_eqn_cell"><math id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_math_unparsed" alttext="\displaystyle\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a_{\text{Bancor}})=\{" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1a"><mrow id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1b"><msup id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.1"><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic" id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.1.2">𝒦</mi><mi id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.1.3">𝕋</mi></msup><mrow id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.2"><mo stretchy="false" id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.2.1">(</mo><msub id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.2.2"><mi id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.2.2.2">a</mi><mtext id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.2.2.3">Bancor</mtext></msub><mo stretchy="false" id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.2.3">)</mo></mrow><mo id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.3">=</mo><mo stretchy="false" id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1.4">{</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.E11X.2.1.1.m1.1c">\displaystyle\mathcal{K}^{\mathbb{T}}(a_{\text{Bancor}})=\{</annotation></semantics></math></td>

<figure id="S6.F6" class="ltx_figure"><img src="./[2103.02228] On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols_files/block-dependency.png" id="S6.F6.g1" class="ltx_graphics ltx_centering ltx_img_landscape" width="598" height="166" alt="Refer to caption">
<figcaption class="ltx_caption ltx_centering"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S6.F6.2.1.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 6</span>: </span><span id="S6.F6.3.2" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">We consider each blockchain block as an independent state representation of the DeFi platform markets. Only if a DeFi market changes in state, we need to re-engage the SMT solver for the affected paths only.</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<div id="S6.SS2.p5" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S6.SS2.p5.3" class="ltx_p"><span id="S6.SS2.p5.3.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Dependency-based Blockchain State Reduction:</span>
If a DeFi state does not change across a number of blockchain blocks, the same SMT solver computation is not re-engaged (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.F6" title="Figure 6 ‣ VI-B DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">6</span></a>). Algorithm&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#alg2" title="In VI-B DeFiPoser-SMT ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">2</span></a> specifies the algorithm we apply to automate the dependency-based blockchain state reduction. Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A7.F15" title="Figure 15 ‣ Appendix G State Dependency ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">15</span></a> in the Appendix shows a timeline analysis of the state dependencies for all considered assets. We observe that ETH experiences the most state changes with over&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="950,000" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.3.2" xref="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.3.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.cmml">950</mn><mo id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.3.2.1" xref="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.3.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2" xref="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.cmml">000</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2b"><list id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.3.2"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1">950</cn><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2.2">000</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p5.1.m1.2c">950,000</annotation></semantics></math> blocks&nbsp;(<math id="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="36.76\%" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1a"><mrow id="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml">36.76</mn><mo id="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml">%</mo></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1b"><apply id="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.1">percent</csymbol><cn type="float" id="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2">36.76</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p5.2.m2.1c">36.76\%</annotation></semantics></math>), followed by DAI&nbsp;(<math id="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="14.62\%" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1a"><mrow id="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml">14.62</mn><mo id="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml">%</mo></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1b"><apply id="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.1">percent</csymbol><cn type="float" id="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.2">14.62</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS2.p5.3.m3.1c">14.62\%</annotation></semantics></math>).</p>
</div>

encoding="application/x-tex" id="alg2.2.2.m2.1c">\leftarrow</annotation></semantics></math> Path <math id="alg2.3.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext=";\," display="inline"><semantics id="alg2.3.3.m3.1a"><mrow id="alg2.3.3.m3.1.1.1"><mi id="alg2.3.3.m3.1.1.1.1" xref="alg2.3.3.m3.1.1.1.1.cmml"></mi><mo id="alg2.3.3.m3.1.1.1.2">;</mo></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" <section id="S6.SS3" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S6.SS3.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">VI-C</span> </span><span id="S6.SS3.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB<span id="S6.SS3.6.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic"> and </span>DeFiPoser-SMT<span id="S6.SS3.6.2.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">: Revenue</span></span>
</h3>

<div id="S6.SS3.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S6.SS3.p1.16" class="ltx_p">We validate both <span id="S6.SS3.p1.16.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span> designs on past blockchain data from block&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="9,100,000" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3.4.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">9</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3.4.2.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.2.2.cmml">100</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3.4.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3.3" xref="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3.3.cmml">000</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3b"><list id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3.4.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3.4.2"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.1.1">9</cn><cn encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.1.m1.3c">9,100,000</annotation></semantics></math> to block&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="10,050,000" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.4.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.4.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">10</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.4.2.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.2.2.cmml">050</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.4.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.3" xref="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.3.cmml">000</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3b"><list id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.4.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.4.2"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.1.1">10</cn><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.2.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.2.2">050</cn><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3.3">000</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.2.m2.3c">10,050,000</annotation></semantics></math>, over a total of <math id="S6.SS3.p1.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="150" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.3.m3.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.3.m3.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml">150</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.3.m3.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.3.m3.1.1">150</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.3.m3.1c">150</annotation></semantics></math> days. We visualize the distribution of traders’ revenue for <span id="S6.SS3.p1.16.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> in Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.F8" title="Figure 8 ‣ VI-C DeFiPoser-ARB and DeFiPoser-SMT: Revenue ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">8</span></a>. <span id="S6.SS3.p1.16.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> found&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="13,317" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2.3.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2.3.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml">13</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2.3.2.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2.3.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2.2.cmml">317</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2b"><list id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2.3.2"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.1.1">13</cn><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2.2">317</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.4.m4.2c">13,317</annotation></semantics></math> strategies consisted of&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="2" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.5.m5.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.5.m5.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.5.m5.1.1.cmml">2</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.5.m5.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.5.m5.1.1">2</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.5.m5.1c">2</annotation></semantics></math> to&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="5" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.6.m6.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.6.m6.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml">5</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.6.m6.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.6.m6.1.1">5</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.6.m6.1c">5</annotation></semantics></math> actions. In total&nbsp;<span id="S6.SS3.p1.16.4" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> yields a total of&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{1552.32}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2.2.4"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml">1</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2.2.4.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2.2.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml">552.32</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.1.1.1.1">1552.32</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.7.m7.2c">\numprint{1552.32}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{620928}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2.2.4"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2.2.3.cmml">620</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2.2.4.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2.2.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2.2.3.cmml">928</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.1.1.1.1">620928</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.8.m8.2c">\numprint{620928}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD), and we observe that the most profitable strategies consist of&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.9.m9.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="3" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.9.m9.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.9.m9.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.9.m9.1.1.cmml">3</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.9.m9.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.9.m9.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.9.m9.1.1">3</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.9.m9.1c">3</annotation></semantics></math> actions, where the highest revenue yielded amounts to&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.10.m10.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{22.40}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.10.m10.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.10.m10.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.10.m10.1.1.cmml">22.40</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.10.m10.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p1.10.m10.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.10.m10.1.1">22.40</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.10.m10.1c">\numprint{22.40}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{8960}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2.2.4"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2.2.3.cmml">8</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2.2.4.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2.2.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2.2.3.cmml">960</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.1.1.1.1">8960</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.11.m11.2c">\numprint{8960}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD). Similarly, Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.F9" title="Figure 9 ‣ VI-C DeFiPoser-ARB and DeFiPoser-SMT: Revenue ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">9</span></a> visualizes the distribution of traders’ revenue for <span id="S6.SS3.p1.16.5" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>. Recall that <span id="S6.SS3.p1.16.6" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> greedily combine multiple paths into a single strategy. We observe that the revenue increases as the number of paths increases, with the highest revenue amounting to&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.12.m12.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{81.31}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.12.m12.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.12.m12.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.12.m12.1.1.cmml">81.31</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.12.m12.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p1.12.m12.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.12.m12.1.1">81.31</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.12.m12.1c">\numprint{81.31}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{32524}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2.2.4"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2.2.3.cmml">32</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2.2.4.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2.2.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2.2.3.cmml">524</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.1.1.1.1">32524</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.13.m13.2c">\numprint{32524}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD). In total, <span id="S6.SS3.p1.16.7" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> finds&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="2,709" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2.3.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2.3.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.1.1.cmml">2</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2.3.2.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2.3.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2.2.cmml">709</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2b"><list id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2.3.2"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.1.1">2</cn><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2.2">709</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.14.m14.2c">2,709</annotation></semantics></math> strategies and yields&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{4103.22}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2.2.4"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2.2.3.cmml">4</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2.2.4.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2.2.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2.2.3.cmml">103.22</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.1.1.1.1">4103.22</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.15.m15.2c">\numprint{4103.22}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{1641288}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3.3.5"><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3.3.4.cmml">1</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3.3.5.1" xref="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3.3.4.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.2.2.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3.3.4.cmml">641</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3.3.5.2" xref="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3.3.4.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3.3.3.3" xref="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3.3.4.cmml">288</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3.3.4.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.1.1.1.1">1641288</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p1.16.m16.3c">\numprint{1641288}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD).</p>
</div>

<figcaption class="ltx_caption ltx_centering"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S6.F7.8.3.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 7</span>: </span><span id="S6.F7.4.2" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Revenue as a function of the initial capital, in ETH with and without flash loans for <span id="S6.F7.4.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> (total of &nbsp;<math id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="2,709" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2b"><mrow id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2.3.2" xref="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2.3.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.F7.3.1.m1.1.1.cmml">2</mn><mo id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2.3.2.1" xref="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2.3.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2.2" xref="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2.2.cmml">709</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2c"><list id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2.3.2"><cn type="integer" id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.F7.3.1.m1.1.1">2</cn><cn type="integer" id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2.2.cmml" xref="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2.2">709</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.F7.3.1.m1.2d">2,709</annotation></semantics></math> found strategies) and <span id="S6.F7.4.2.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> (total of&nbsp;<math id="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="1,556" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2b"><mrow id="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2.3.2" xref="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2.3.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.F7.4.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.F7.4.2.m2.1.1.cmml">1</mn><mo id="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2.3.2.1" xref="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2.3.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2.2" xref="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2.2.cmml">556</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2c"><list id="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2.3.1.cmml" xref="S6.F7.4.2.m2.2.3.2"><cn type="integer" id="S6.F7.4.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.F7.4.2.m2.1.1">1</cn><cn found strategies).</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<figure id="S6.F8" class="ltx_figure"><img src="./[2103.02228] On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols_files/x11.png" id="S6.F8.1.g1" class="ltx_graphics ltx_centering ltx_img_landscape" width="438" height="207" alt="Refer to caption">
<figcaption class="ltx_caption"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S6.F8.4.1.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 8</span>: </span><span id="S6.F8.5.2" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Analytical distribution of the trader’s revenue. The majority of the most profitable strategies consist of&nbsp;3 actions. Because <span id="S6.F8.5.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> requires manual modeling, the revenues discovered by Z3 are not accurate, and thus the number of discovered strategies (yellow) are less than the profitable strategies (blue). We use concrete execution to validate the strategies from Z3.</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<figure id="S6.F9" class="ltx_figure"><img src="./[2103.02228] On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols_files/x12.png" id="S6.F9.1.g1" class="ltx_graphics ltx_centering ltx_img_landscape" width="438" height="206" alt="Refer to caption">
<figcaption class="ltx_caption"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S6.F9.5.1.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 9</span>: </span><span id="S6.F9.6.2" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Distribution of the trader’s revenue using <span id="S6.F9.6.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>. We observe that the revenue increases as the number of paths increases. We also visualize the distribution of the most profitable sub-path (orange) for every strategy. Intuitively, the more paths <span id="S6.F9.6.2.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> try to combine, the higher the revenue.</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<div id="S6.SS3.p2" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S6.SS3.p2.7" class="ltx_p">We visualize in Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.F7" title="Figure 7 ‣ VI-C DeFiPoser-ARB and DeFiPoser-SMT: Revenue ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">7</span></a> the revenue generated by <span id="S6.SS3.p2.7.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> and <span id="S6.SS3.p2.7.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> as a function of the initial capital. If a trader owns the <em id="S6.SS3.p2.7.3" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">base</em> asset (e.g., ETH), most strategies require less than <math id="S6.SS3.p2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="150" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p2.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml">150</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p2.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p2.1.m1.1.1">150</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p2.1.m1.1c">150</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH. Only <math id="S6.SS3.p2.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="10" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p2.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p2.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml">10</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p2.2.m2.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p2.2.m2.1.1">10</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p2.2.m2.1c">10</annotation></semantics></math> strategies require more than <math id="S6.SS3.p2.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="100" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p2.3.m3.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p2.3.m3.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml">100</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p2.3.m3.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p2.3.m3.1.1">100</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p2.3.m3.1c">100</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH for <span id="S6.SS3.p2.7.4" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span>, and only <math id="S6.SS3.p2.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="7" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p2.4.m4.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p2.4.m4.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p2.4.m4.1.1.cmml">7</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p2.4.m4.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p2.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p2.4.m4.1.1">7</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p2.4.m4.1c">7</annotation></semantics></math> strategies require more than <math id="S6.SS3.p2.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="150" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p2.5.m5.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p2.5.m5.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p2.5.m5.1.1.cmml">150</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p2.5.m5.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p2.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p2.5.m5.1.1">150</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p2.5.m5.1c">150</annotation></semantics></math> ETH for <span id="S6.SS3.p2.7.5" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>. This capital requirement is reduced to less than <math id="S6.SS3.p2.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{1.00}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p2.6.m6.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p2.6.m6.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p2.6.m6.1.1.cmml">1.00</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p2.6.m6.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p2.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p2.6.m6.1.1">1.00</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p2.6.m6.1c">\numprint{1.00}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S6.SS3.p2.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{400}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p2.7.m7.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p2.7.m7.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p2.7.m7.1.1.cmml">400</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p2.7.m7.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p2.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p2.7.m7.1.1">400</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p2.7.m7.1c">\numprint{400}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) when using flash loans (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.F7" title="Figure 7 ‣ VI-C DeFiPoser-ARB and DeFiPoser-SMT: Revenue ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">7</span></a> (b, d)).</p>
</div>

<div id="S6.SS3.p3" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S6.SS3.p3.9" class="ltx_p">Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.F10.sf1" title="In Figure 10 ‣ VI-C DeFiPoser-ARB and DeFiPoser-SMT: Revenue ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">10(a)</span></a> shows how our concrete execution validation over&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p3.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="150" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p3.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml">150</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p3.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p3.1.m1.1.1">150</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p3.1.m1.1c">150</annotation></semantics></math> days yields consistent revenue for both tools. The concrete execution estimates a weekly revenue of <math id="S6.SS3.p3.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{191.48}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p3.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.9.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> and <math id="S6.SS3.p3.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{72.44}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p3.5.m5.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p3.5.m5.2.2.4"><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.5.m5.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p3.5.m5.2.2.3.cmml">28</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p3.5.m5.2.2.4.1" id="S6.SS3.p3.5.m5.2c">\numprint{28976}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) for <span id="S6.SS3.p3.9.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span>. For <span id="S6.SS3.p3.9.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span>, our validation estimates a total revenue of&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p3.6.m6.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{1552.32}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p3.6.m6.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p3.6.m6.2.2.4"><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.6.m6.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p3.6.m6.2.2.3.cmml">1</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p3.6.m6.2b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p3.6.m6.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p3.6.m6.1.1.1.1">1552.32</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p3.6.m6.2c">\numprint{1552.32}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{620928}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2.2.4"><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml">620</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2.2.4.1" xref="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2.2.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml">928</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.1.1.1.1">620928</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p3.7.m7.2c">\numprint{620928}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) out of&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p3.8.m8.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{3577.14}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p3.8.m8.2a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p3.8.m8.2.2.4"><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.8.m8.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p3.8.m8.2.2.3.cmml">3</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p3.8.m8.2.2.4.1" xref="S6.SS3.p3.8.m8.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{1430856}" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3.3.5"><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3.3.4.cmml">1</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3.3.5.1" xref="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3.3.4.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.2.2.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3.3.4.cmml">430</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3.3.5.2" xref="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3.3.4.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3.3.3.3" xref="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3.3.4.cmml">856</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3.3.4.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.1.1.1.1">1430856</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p3.9.m9.3c">\numprint{1430856}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) (i.e., 40% of the Z3 indicated revenue is validated in practice).</p>
</div>
<div id="S6.SS3.p4" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S6.SS3.p4.2" class="ltx_p"><span id="S6.SS3.p4.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Cost Analysis:</span>
The trader’s principal costs are the blockchain transaction fees (e.g., gas in Ethereum), which remain below the revenue yielded by the strategies we validated (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.F11" title="Figure 11 ‣ VI-C DeFiPoser-ARB and DeFiPoser-SMT: Revenue ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">11</span></a>). Note that a trading strategy may fail if the underlying market state changes before its execution. Therefore, we assume that the trader adopts the gas price of&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p4.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="32" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p4.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p4.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p4.1.m1.1.1.cmml">32</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p4.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p4.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p4.1.m1.1.1">32</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p4.1.m1.1c">32</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;GWei, which is highly volatile, but the recommended fast transaction gas price at the time of writing. Summarizing, the execution of all strategies costs less than&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p4.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="0.05" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p4.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.cmml">0.05</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p4.2.m2.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p4.2.m2.1.1">0.05</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p4.2.m2.1c">0.05</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH, which warrants all strategies to be profitable.</p>
</div>
<figure id="S6.F11" class="ltx_figure">
<div class="ltx_flex_figure">
<div class="ltx_flex_cell ltx_flex_size_1">
