</figure>
</div>
<div class="ltx_flex_break"></div>
<div class="ltx_flex_cell ltx_flex_size_1">
<figure id="S6.F11.sf2" class="ltx_figure ltx_figure_panel ltx_align_center"><img src="./[2103.02228] On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols_files/x15.png" id="S6.F11.sf2.g1" class="ltx_graphics ltx_img_landscape" width="461" height="214" alt="Refer to caption">
<figcaption class="ltx_caption"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S6.F11.sf2.3.1.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">(b)</span> </span><span id="S6.F11.sf2.4.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps" style="font-size:90%;">DeFiPoser-ARB</span></figcaption>
</figure>
</div>
</div>
<figcaption class="ltx_caption ltx_centering"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S6.F11.5.1.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 11</span>: </span><span id="S6.F11.6.2" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Distribution of revenue and transaction cost based on concrete execution on the EVM for <span id="S6.F11.6.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> and <span id="S6.F11.6.2.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>. The revenue outpaces the transaction costs, which are higher for <span id="S6.F11.6.2.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> because the found strategies often consist of more cycles (arbitrage opportunities).</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<figure id="S6.F12" class="ltx_figure"><img src="./[2103.02228] On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols_files/x16.png" id="S6.F12.g1" class="ltx_graphics ltx_centering ltx_img_landscape" width="461" height="224" alt="Refer to caption">
<figcaption class="ltx_caption ltx_centering"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S6.F12.6.2.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 12</span>: </span><span id="S6.F12.2.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Analysis time distribution to detect a profitable strategy on <span id="S6.F12.2.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> and <span id="S6.F12.2.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>. For most strategies the search and validation process remains below the average Ethereum block time of&nbsp;<math id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="13.5\pm 0.12" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1b"><mrow id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml">13.5</mn><mo id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.1" xref="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml">±</mo><mn id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml">0.12</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1c"><apply id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.1">plus-or-minus</csymbol><cn type="float" id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.2">13.5</cn><cn type="float" id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1.1.3">0.12</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.F12.2.1.m1.1d">13.5\pm 0.12</annotation></semantics></math> seconds.</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<figure id="S6.F13" class="ltx_figure"><img src="./[2103.02228] On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols_files/x17.png" id="S6.F13.g1" class="ltx_graphics ltx_centering ltx_img_landscape" width="461" height="226" alt="Refer to caption">
<figcaption class="ltx_caption ltx_centering"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S6.F13.6.2.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 13</span>: </span><span id="S6.F13.2.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">The analysis time of <span id="S6.F13.2.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> exceeds our estimated time limit (taking into consideration block time and transaction network propagation to miners), when <span id="S6.F13.2.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> exploits more than&nbsp;<math id="S6.F13.2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="6" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.F13.2.1.m1.1b"><mn id="S6.F13.2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.F13.2.1.m1.1.1.cmml">6</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.F13.2.1.m1.1c"><cn type="integer" id="S6.F13.2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.F13.2.1.m1.1.1">6</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.F13.2.1.m1.1d">6</annotation></semantics></math> cycles.</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<div id="S6.SS3.p5" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S6.SS3.p5.7" class="ltx_p"><span id="S6.SS3.p5.7.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Performance Analysis:</span> Our tools must find trades within the average Ethereum block time of <math id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="13.5\pm 0.12" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml">13.5</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml">±</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml">0.12</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.1">plus-or-minus</csymbol><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.2">13.5</cn><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1.1.3">0.12</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p5.1.m1.1c">13.5\pm 0.12</annotation></semantics></math> seconds&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib9" title="" class="ltx_ref">9</a>]</cite> to be applicable in real-time. Assuming a network propagation latency of roughly three seconds towards miners in the blockchain P2P network&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib22" title="" class="ltx_ref">22</a>]</cite>, our tools must generate transactions within at most <math id="S6.SS3.p5.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="10.5" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p5.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p5.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p5.2.m2.1.1.cmml">10.5</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p5.2.m2.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p5.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p5.2.m2.1.1">10.5</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p5.2.m2.1c">10.5</annotation></semantics></math> seconds. Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.F12" title="Figure 12 ‣ VI-C DeFiPoser-ARB and DeFiPoser-SMT: Revenue ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">12</span></a> shows the detailed execution speed of <span id="S6.SS3.p5.7.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> and <span id="S6.SS3.p5.7.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> on an AMD Ryzen Threadripper <math id="S6.SS3.p5.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="3990" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p5.3.m3.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p5.3.m3.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p5.3.m3.1.1.cmml">3990</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p5.3.m3.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p5.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p5.3.m3.1.1">3990</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p5.3.m3.1c">3990</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;X Processor (<math id="S6.SS3.p5.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="4.3" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p5.4.m4.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p5.4.m4.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p5.4.m4.1.1.cmml">4.3</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p5.4.m4.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p5.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p5.4.m4.1.1">4.3</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p5.4.m4.1c">4.3</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;GHz,&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p5.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="64" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p5.5.m5.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p5.5.m5.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p5.5.m5.1.1.cmml">64</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p5.5.m5.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p5.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p5.5.m5.1.1">64</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p5.5.m5.1c">64</annotation></semantics></math> cores) CPU. For new block states, we measure a total average computing time of <math id="S6.SS3.p5.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="6.43" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p5.6.m6.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p5.6.m6.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p5.6.m6.1.1.cmml">6.43</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p5.6.m6.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p5.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p5.6.m6.1.1">6.43</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p5.6.m6.1c">6.43</annotation></semantics></math> seconds and <math id="S6.SS3.p5.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="5.39" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p5.7.m7.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p5.7.m7.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p5.7.m7.1.1.cmml">5.39</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p5.7.m7.1b"><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p5.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p5.7.m7.1.1">5.39</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p5.7.m7.1c">5.39</annotation></semantics></math> seconds per block, respectively.</p>
</div>
<div id="S6.SS3.p6" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S6.SS3.p6.2" class="ltx_p">We further group the strategies detected by <span id="S6.SS3.p6.2.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> based on the number of negative cycles and compare the respective analysis time (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S6.F13" title="Figure 13 ‣ VI-C DeFiPoser-ARB and DeFiPoser-SMT: Revenue ‣ VI Experimental Evaluation ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">13</span></a>). We find that <span id="S6.SS3.p6.2.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> exceeds our estimated time limit (<math id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="13.5-3=10.5" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1a"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mrow id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml"><mn id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.2" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.2.cmml">13.5</mn><mo id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.1" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.1.cmml">−</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.3" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.3.cmml">3</mn></mrow><mo id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml">=</mo><mn id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml">10.5</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1"><eq id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.1"></eq><apply id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2"><minus id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.1"></minus><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.2">13.5</cn><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.2.3">3</cn></apply><cn type="float" id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1.1.3">10.5</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p6.1.m1.1c">13.5-3=10.5</annotation></semantics></math> seconds) when exploiting more than&nbsp;<math id="S6.SS3.p6.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="6" display="inline"><semantics id="S6.SS3.p6.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S6.SS3.p6.2.m2.1.1" xref="S6.SS3.p6.2.m2.1.1.cmml">6</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S6.SS3.p6.2.m2.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S6.SS3.p6.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S6.SS3.p6.2.m2.1.1">6</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S6.SS3.p6.2.m2.1c">6</annotation></semantics></math> cycles. The higher the total number of negative cycles, the more likely <span id="S6.SS3.p6.2.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> misses the most profitable opportunity.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<section id="S7" class="ltx_section">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_title_section">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_section">VII </span><span id="S7.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">Profitable Transactions and Blockchain Security</span>
</h2>

<div id="S7.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S7.p1.1" class="ltx_p">In this section, we show that <span id="S7.p1.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> is capable of identifying the economic bZx attack from February 2020&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib53" title="" class="ltx_ref">53</a>]</cite> and provide forensic insights into the event. Given optimal adversarial strategies provided by an MDP, we then quantify whether an MEV opportunity will cause a rational miner to create a blockchain fork.</p>
</div>
<section id="S7.SS1" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S7.SS1.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">VII-A</span> </span><span id="S7.SS1.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Economic bZx Attack</span>
</h3>

<div id="S7.SS1.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S7.SS1.p1.4" class="ltx_p">On the&nbsp;15th of February,&nbsp;2020, a trader performed a pump and arbitrage attack on the margin trading platform bZx<span id="footnote3" class="ltx_note ltx_role_footnote"><sup class="ltx_note_mark">3</sup><span class="ltx_note_outer"><span class="ltx_note_content"><sup class="ltx_note_mark">3</sup><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_note">3</span>transaction id: 0xb5c8bd9430b6cc87a0e2fe110ece6bf527fa4f170a4bc8cd032f768fc5219838</span></span></span>. The core of this trade was a pump and arbitrage involving four DeFi platforms atomically executed in one single transaction. As a previous study shows, this trade resulted in in&nbsp;<math id="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{4337.62}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2a"><mrow id="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2.2.4"><mn id="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2.2.3.cmml">4</mn><mo id="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2.2.4.1" xref="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2.2.2.2" xref="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2.2.3.cmml">337.62</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2b"><cn type="float" id="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.1.1.1.1">4337.62</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS1.p1.1.m1.2c">\numprint{4337.62}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{1735048}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3a"><mrow id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3.3.5"><mn id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.1.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3.3.4.cmml">1</mn><mo id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3.3.5.1" xref="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3.3.4.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.2.2.2.2" xref="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3.3.4.cmml">735</mn><mo id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3.3.5.2" xref="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3.3.4.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3.3.3.3" xref="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3.3.4.cmml">048</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3b"><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3.3.4.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.1.1.1.1">1735048</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS1.p1.2.m2.3c">\numprint{1735048}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) loss from bZx loan providers, where the trader gained&nbsp;<math id="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{1193.69}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2a"><mrow id="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2.2.4"><mn id="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.1.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml">1</mn><mo id="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2.2.4.1" xref="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2.2.2.2" xref="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml">193.69</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2b"><cn type="float" id="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.1.1.1.1">1193.69</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS1.p1.3.m3.2c">\numprint{1193.69}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{477476}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2a"><mrow id="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2.2.4"><mn id="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.1.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2.2.3.cmml">477</mn><mo id="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2.2.4.1" xref="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2.2.2.2" xref="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2.2.3.cmml">476</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.1.1.1.1">477476</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS1.p1.4.m4.2c">\numprint{477476}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) in total&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib53" title="" class="ltx_ref">53</a>]</cite>.</p>
</div>
<div id="S7.SS1.p2" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S7.SS1.p2.4" class="ltx_p"><span id="S7.SS1.p2.4.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Attack Window:</span>
To gain deeper insights into this DeFi composability event, we extend <span id="S7.SS1.p2.4.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> with two additional actions: <em id="S7.SS1.p2.4.3" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">(i)</em> borrow WBTC with ETH on compound finance; <em id="S7.SS1.p2.4.4" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">(ii)</em> short ETH for WBTC on bZx. We replayed <span id="S7.SS1.p2.4.5" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> on historical blockchain data by starting at the creation of the bZx’s margin short smart contract (cf.&nbsp;Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A8.F16" title="Figure 16 ‣ Appendix H bZx ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">16</span></a>). Surprisingly, the bZx attack window lasted for&nbsp;<math id="S7.SS1.p2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="69" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS1.p2.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S7.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S7.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml">69</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS1.p2.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p2.1.m1.1.1">69</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS1.p2.1.m1.1c">69</annotation></semantics></math> days until it was openly exploited. <span id="S7.SS1.p2.4.6" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> finds that the attack yielded the highest revenue of <math id="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{2291.02}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2a"><mrow id="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2.2.4"><mn id="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2.2.3.cmml">2</mn><mo id="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2.2.4.1" xref="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2.2.2.2" xref="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2.2.3.cmml">291.02</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2b"><cn type="float" id="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.1.1.1.1">2291.02</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS1.p2.2.m2.2c">\numprint{2291.02}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{916408}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2a"><mrow id="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2.2.4"><mn id="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.1.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml">916</mn><mo id="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2.2.4.1" xref="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2.2.2.2" xref="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml">408</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.1.1.1.1">916408</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS1.p2.3.m3.2c">\numprint{916408}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) at block&nbsp;<math id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3" class="ltx_Math" alttext="9,482,670" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3a"><mrow id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.4.2" xref="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.4.1.cmml"><mn id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.1.1" xref="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.1.1.cmml">9</mn><mo id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.4.2.1" xref="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.2.2" xref="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.2.2.cmml">482</mn><mo id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.4.2.2" xref="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.4.1.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.3" xref="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.3.cmml">670</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3b"><list id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.4.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.4.2"><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.1.1">9</cn><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.2.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.2.2">482</cn><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3.3">670</cn></list></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS1.p2.4.m4.3c">9,482,670</annotation></semantics></math>, which is about one day before the attack occurred.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S7.SS2" class="ltx_subsection">
<h3 class="ltx_title ltx_title_subsection">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_subsection"><span id="S7.SS2.5.1.1" class="ltx_text">VII-B</span> </span><span id="S7.SS2.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">MEV, an MDP and Optimal Adversarial Strategies</span>
</h3>

<div id="S7.SS2.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S7.SS2.p1.3" class="ltx_p">The economic bZx attack revenue exceeds the average Ethereum block reward<span id="footnote4" class="ltx_note ltx_role_footnote"><sup class="ltx_note_mark">4</sup><span class="ltx_note_outer"><span class="ltx_note_content"><sup class="ltx_note_mark">4</sup><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_note">4</span>At the time of writing, the average Ethereum block reward is <math id="footnote4.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="2.62" display="inline"><semantics id="footnote4.m1.1b"><mn id="footnote4.m1.1.1" xref="footnote4.m1.1.1.cmml">2.62</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="footnote4.m1.1c"><cn type="float" id="footnote4.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="footnote4.m1.1.1">2.62</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="footnote4.m1.1d">2.62</annotation></semantics></math> ETH (<a target="_blank" href="https://bitinfocharts.com/ethereum/" title="" class="ltx_ref ltx_url ltx_font_typewriter">https://bitinfocharts.com/ethereum/</a>)</span></span></span> by a factor of <math id="S7.SS2.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_math_unparsed" alttext="874\times" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p1.1.m1.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p1.1.m1.1b"><mn id="S7.SS2.p1.1.m1.1.1">874</mn><mo lspace="0.222em" id="S7.SS2.p1.1.m1.1.2">×</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p1.1.m1.1c">874\times</annotation></semantics></math>. After bZx, the other most profitable validated strategies found by <span id="S7.SS2.p1.3.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> and <span id="S7.SS2.p1.3.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> exceed the block reward by a factor of <math id="S7.SS2.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_math_unparsed" alttext="31\times" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p1.2.m2.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p1.2.m2.1b"><mn id="S7.SS2.p1.2.m2.1.1">31</mn><mo lspace="0.222em" id="S7.SS2.p1.2.m2.1.2">×</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p1.2.m2.1c">31\times</annotation></semantics></math> and <math id="S7.SS2.p1.3.m3.1" class="ltx_math_unparsed" alttext="8.5\times" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p1.3.m3.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p1.3.m3.1b"><mn id="S7.SS2.p1.3.m3.1.1">8.5</mn><mo lspace="0.222em" id="S7.SS2.p1.3.m3.1.2">×</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p1.3.m3.1c">8.5\times</annotation></semantics></math> respectively. In this section, we quantify the value at which an MEV-aware miner would exploit an MEV opportunity by forking the blockchain.</p>
</div>
<div id="S7.SS2.p2" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S7.SS2.p2.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S7.SS2.p2.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Markov Decision Process:</span>
A Markov Decision Process is a single-player decision process that allows identifying the optimal strategies for an encoded decision problem. In this work, we adopt the state transition and reward matrix of the PoW double-spending MDP of Gervais <em id="S7.SS2.p2.1.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">et al.</em>&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib31" title="" class="ltx_ref">31</a>]</cite>. Note that the MDP we use does not consider uncle rewards.</p>
</div>
<div id="S7.SS2.p3" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S7.SS2.p3.1" class="ltx_p">We observe that conceptually, an MEV opportunity is equivalent to a double-spending opportunity: if an MEV opportunity is mined by an honest miner, and an adversarial miner aims to claim the MEV opportunity, the MEV miner will need to outrun the honest chain with a fork. The MEV miner will hence want to follow the optimal adversarial strategies given by the MDP, which advises whether to fork or not to fork the blockchain depending on the MEV value.</p>
</div>
<div id="S7.SS2.p4" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S7.SS2.p4.8" class="ltx_p"><span id="S7.SS2.p4.8.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Threat Model:</span>
We assume a rational and computationally bounded adversary. Because MDP’s are single-player decision problems, we assume the existence of only one adversarial miner willing to exploit MEV. We parametrize the miner with a hash rate <math id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1" class="ltx_math_unparsed" alttext="\alpha\in]0,0.5[" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1b"><mi id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.1">α</mi><mo rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.2">∈</mo><mo stretchy="false" id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.3">]</mo><mn id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.4">0</mn><mo id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.5">,</mo><mn id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.6">0.5</mn><mo stretchy="false" id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1.7">[</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p4.1.m1.1c">\alpha\in]0,0.5[</annotation></semantics></math>, while the remaining non-MEV miners have a hash rate of <math id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="1-\alpha" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><mn id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml">1</mn><mo id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml">−</mo><mi id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml">α</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1"><minus id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.1"></minus><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.2">1</cn><ci id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1.1.3">𝛼</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p4.2.m2.1c">1-\alpha</annotation></semantics></math>. We ignore the existence of eclipse attacks (<math id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\omega=0" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml">ω</mi><mo id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml">=</mo><mn id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml">0</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1"><eq id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.1"></eq><ci id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.2">𝜔</ci><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1.1.3">0</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p4.3.m3.1c">\omega=0</annotation></semantics></math>) and assume the weakest possible network propagation parameter of the adversary (<math id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\gamma=0" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml">γ</mi><mo id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.1.cmml">=</mo><mn id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.3.cmml">0</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1"><eq id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.1"></eq><ci id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.2">𝛾</ci><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1.1.3">0</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p4.4.m4.1c">\gamma=0</annotation></semantics></math>). We parametrize the MDP with the stale block rate of the Ethereum blockchain at the time of writing. By crawling the number of uncle blocks (from the block <math id="S7.SS2.p4.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="9.1" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p4.5.m5.1a"><mn id="S7.SS2.p4.5.m5.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.5.m5.1.1.cmml">9.1</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p4.5.m5.1b"><cn type="float" id="S7.SS2.p4.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.5.m5.1.1">9.1</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p4.5.m5.1c">9.1</annotation></semantics></math>M to <math id="S7.SS2.p4.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="10.5" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p4.6.m6.1a"><mn id="S7.SS2.p4.6.m6.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.6.m6.1.1.cmml">10.5</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p4.6.m6.1b"><cn type="float" id="S7.SS2.p4.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.6.m6.1.1">10.5</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p4.6.m6.1c">10.5</annotation></semantics></math>M), we approximate the stale block rate to <math id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="r_{s}=5.72\%" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.cmml"><msub id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.2" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.2.cmml">r</mi><mi id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.3" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.3.cmml">s</mi></msub><mo id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.1.cmml">=</mo><mrow id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3.cmml"><mn id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3.2" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3.2.cmml">5.72</mn><mo id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3.1.cmml">%</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1"><eq id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.1"></eq><apply id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.2">𝑟</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.2.3">𝑠</ci></apply><apply id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3.1">percent</csymbol><cn type="float" id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1.1.3.2">5.72</cn></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p4.7.m7.1c">r_{s}=5.72\%</annotation></semantics></math>. We set the mining costs to match the hash rate of the MEV miner (<math id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="c_{m}=\alpha" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.cmml"><msub id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.2" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.2.cmml">c</mi><mi id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.3" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.3.cmml">m</mi></msub><mo id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.1.cmml">=</mo><mi id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.3.cmml">α</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1"><eq id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.1"></eq><apply id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.2">𝑐</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.2.3">𝑚</ci></apply><ci id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1.1.3">𝛼</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p4.8.m8.1c">c_{m}=\alpha</annotation></semantics></math>).</p>
</div>
<div id="S7.SS2.p5" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S7.SS2.p5.8" class="ltx_p"><span id="S7.SS2.p5.8.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Exploit or not exploit MEV?</span>
Each time an MEV opportunity arises on the network layer, we assume that the honest miner succeeds in mining the MEV opportunity, and the MEV miner fails to receive the reward initially. The MEV miner, therefore, needs to decide whether to start to mine on a private chain, where he claims the MEV opportunity. Note that the MDP’s <math id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="exit" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml">e</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml">x</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1a" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.4" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.4.cmml">i</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1b" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.5" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.5.cmml">t</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1"><times id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.1"></times><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.2">𝑒</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.3">𝑥</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.4.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.4">𝑖</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.5.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1.1.5">𝑡</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p5.1.m1.1c">exit</annotation></semantics></math> state can only be reached when the MEV miner mined a private chain that is longer than the honest chain (<math id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="l_{a}&gt;l_{h}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.cmml"><msub id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.2" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.2.cmml">l</mi><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.3" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.3.cmml">a</mi></msub><mo id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml">&gt;</mo><msub id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.2" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.2.cmml">l</mi><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.3" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.3.cmml">h</mi></msub></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1"><gt id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.1"></gt><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.2">𝑙</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.2.3">𝑎</ci></apply><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.2">𝑙</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1.1.3.3">ℎ</ci></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p5.2.m2.1c">l_{a}&gt;l_{h}</annotation></semantics></math>) given <math id="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="k=1" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.2" encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1"><eq id="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.1"></eq><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.2">𝑘</ci><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1.1.3">1</cn></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p5.3.m3.1c">k=1</annotation></semantics></math> (<math id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="l_{a}&gt;k" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.cmml"><msub id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.2" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.2.cmml">l</mi><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.3" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.3.cmml">a</mi></msub><mo id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.cmml">&gt;</mo><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.3.cmml">k</mi></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1"><gt id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.1"></gt><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.2">𝑙</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.2.3">𝑎</ci></apply><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1.1.3">𝑘</ci></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p5.4.m4.1c">l_{a}&gt;k</annotation></semantics></math>). <em id="S7.SS2.p5.5.1" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">Depending on the MEV value, the optimal strategy <math id="S7.SS2.p5.5.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\pi" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p5.5.1.m1.1a"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.5.1.m1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.5.1.m1.1.1.cmml">π</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p5.5.1.m1.1b"><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.5.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.5.1.m1.1.1">𝜋</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p5.5.1.m1.1c">\pi</annotation></semantics></math> might advise against forking the chain to attempt to claim the MEV reward.</em> We quantify the minimal MEV value <math id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="MEV_{v}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.2.cmml">M</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.3.cmml">E</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.1a" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><msub id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.2" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.2.cmml">V</mi><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.3" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.3.cmml">v</mi></msub></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1"><times id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.1"></times><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.2">𝑀</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.3">𝐸</ci><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.2">𝑉</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1.1.4.3">𝑣</ci></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p5.6.m5.1c">MEV_{v}</annotation></semantics></math>, such that <math id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="MEV_{v}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.2.cmml">M</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.3.cmml">E</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.1a" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><msub id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.2" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.2.cmml">V</mi><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.3" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.3.cmml">v</mi></msub></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1"><times id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.1"></times><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.2">𝑀</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.3">𝐸</ci><apply id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.2">𝑉</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1.1.4.3">𝑣</ci></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p5.7.m6.1c">MEV_{v}</annotation></semantics></math> is strictly larger than the reward from honest mining (cf.&nbsp;Equation&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S7.E13" title="In VII-B MEV, an MDP and Optimal Adversarial Strategies ‣ VII Profitable Transactions and Blockchain Security ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">13</span></a>). We denote <math id="S7.SS2.p5.8.m7.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="h" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p5.8.m7.1a"><mi id="S7.SS2.p5.8.m7.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p5.8.m7.1.1.cmml">h</mi><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p5.8.m7.1b"><ci id="S7.SS2.p5.8.m7.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p5.8.m7.1.1">ℎ</ci></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p5.8.m7.1c">h</annotation></semantics></math> is the process of mining honestly.</p>
<table id="S7.E12" class="ltx_equation ltx_eqn_table">

<tbody><tr class="ltx_equation ltx_eqn_row ltx_align_baseline">
<td class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_eqn_center_padleft"></td>

id="S7.E13.m1.6.6.2.2.2.2.3.2.1.cmml" xref="S7.E13.m1.6.6.2.2.2.2.3.2.1"></exists><ci id="S7.E13.m1.6.6.2.2.2.2.3.2.2.cmml" xref="S7.E13.m1.6.6.2.2.2.2.3.2.2">𝜋</ci></apply><ci A:R(\pi,P,MEV_{v})&gt;R(h,P)\}</annotation></semantics></math></td>
<td class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_eqn_center_padright"></td>
<td rowspan="1" class="ltx_eqn_cell ltx_eqn_eqno ltx_align_middle ltx_align_right"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_equation ltx_align_right">(13)</span></td>
</tr></tbody>
</table>
</div>
<div id="S7.SS2.p6" class="ltx_para">

the lowest value for <math id="S7.SS2.p6.8.m8.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="MEV_{v}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p6.8.m8.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p6.8.m8.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p6.8.m8.1.1.cmml"><mi xref="S7.SS2.p6.8.m8.1.1.3.cmml">E</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p6.8.m8.1.1.1a" xref="S7.SS2.p6.8.m8.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><msub id="S7.SS2.p6.8.m8.1.1.4" given a margin of error of <math id="S7.SS2.p6.9.m9.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="0.1" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p6.9.m9.1a"><mn id="S7.SS2.p6.9.m9.1.1" </div>
<div id="S7.SS2.p7" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S7.SS2.p7.5" class="ltx_p"><span id="S7.SS2.p7.5.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Results:</span> We visualize our findings in Figure&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#S7.F14" title="Figure 14 ‣ VII-B MEV, an MDP and Optimal Adversarial Strategies ‣ VII Profitable Transactions and Blockchain Security ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">14</span></a>, which shows that for an MEV miner with <math id="S7.SS2.p7.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="10" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p7.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S7.SS2.p7.1.m1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p7.1.m1.1.1.cmml">10</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p7.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS2.p7.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.1.m1.1.1">10</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p7.1.m1.1c">10</annotation></semantics></math>% hash rate, on Ethereum (stale block rate of <math id="S7.SS2.p7.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="5.72" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p7.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S7.SS2.p7.2.m2.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p7.2.m2.1.1.cmml">5.72</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p7.2.m2.1b"><cn type="float" id="S7.SS2.p7.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.2.m2.1.1">5.72</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p7.2.m2.1c">5.72</annotation></semantics></math>%), <math id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="MEV_{v}" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1a"><mrow id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.2" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml">M</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><mi id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.3" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml">E</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em" id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.1a" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml">​</mo><msub id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.cmml"><mi id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.2" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.2.cmml">V</mi><mi id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.3" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.3.cmml">v</mi></msub></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1b"><apply id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1"><times id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.1"></times><ci id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.2">𝑀</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.3">𝐸</ci><apply id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.2.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.2">𝑉</ci><ci id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.3.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1.1.4.3">𝑣</ci></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p7.3.m3.1c">MEV_{v}</annotation></semantics></math> equals to <math id="S7.SS2.p7.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="4" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p7.4.m4.1a"><mn id="S7.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.cmml">4</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p7.4.m4.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.4.m4.1.1">4</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p7.4.m4.1c">4</annotation></semantics></math>. We conclude that in this case, if an MEV opportunity yields at least a reward that is <math id="S7.SS2.p7.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="3" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.SS2.p7.5.m5.1a"><mn id="S7.SS2.p7.5.m5.1.1" xref="S7.SS2.p7.5.m5.1.1.cmml">3</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.SS2.p7.5.m5.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S7.SS2.p7.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.SS2.p7.5.m5.1.1">3</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.SS2.p7.5.m5.1c">3</annotation></semantics></math> times higher than the block reward, then an MEV miner which follows the optimal strategies will fork the blockchain. A fork of the blockchain deteriorates the blockchain’s security as it increases the risks of double-spending and selfish mining&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib31" title="" class="ltx_ref">31</a>]</cite>.</p>
</div>
<figure id="S7.F14" class="ltx_figure"><img src="./[2103.02228] On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols_files/x18.png" id="S7.F14.g1" class="ltx_graphics ltx_centering ltx_img_landscape" width="461" height="287" alt="Refer to caption">
<figcaption class="ltx_caption ltx_centering"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_figure"><span id="S7.F14.8.4.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Figure 14</span>: </span><span id="S7.F14.6.3" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">Minimum MEV value in terms of block rewards to fork a PoW blockchain, given by optimal adversarial strategies of the MDP. For instance, on Ethereum (<math id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="r_{s}=5.72\%" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1b"><mrow id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.cmml"><msub id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml"><mi id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.2" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.2.cmml">r</mi><mi id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.3" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.3.cmml">s</mi></msub><mo id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.1" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml">=</mo><mrow id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml"><mn id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3.2" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3.2.cmml">5.72</mn><mo id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3.1" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3.1.cmml">%</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1c"><apply id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1"><eq id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.1"></eq><apply id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.cmml" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2"><csymbol cd="ambiguous" id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.1.cmml" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2">subscript</csymbol><ci id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.2.cmml" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.2">𝑟</ci><ci id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.3.cmml" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.2.3">𝑠</ci></apply><apply id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3.cmml" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3"><csymbol cd="latexml" id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3.1.cmml" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3.1">percent</csymbol><cn type="float" id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3.2.cmml" xref="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1.1.3.2">5.72</cn></apply></apply></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.F14.4.1.m1.1d">r_{s}=5.72\%</annotation></semantics></math>), a miner with <math id="S7.F14.5.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="10" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.F14.5.2.m2.1b"><mn id="S7.F14.5.2.m2.1.1" xref="S7.F14.5.2.m2.1.1.cmml">10</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.F14.5.2.m2.1c"><cn type="integer" id="S7.F14.5.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.F14.5.2.m2.1.1">10</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.F14.5.2.m2.1d">10</annotation></semantics></math>% hash rate will engage to fork the chain to exploit an MEV opportunity, if the adversary follows the optimal strategy and the MEV opportunity yields more than <math id="S7.F14.6.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="4" display="inline"><semantics id="S7.F14.6.3.m3.1b"><mn id="S7.F14.6.3.m3.1.1" xref="S7.F14.6.3.m3.1.1.cmml">4</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S7.F14.6.3.m3.1c"><cn type="integer" id="S7.F14.6.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S7.F14.6.3.m3.1.1">4</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S7.F14.6.3.m3.1d">4</annotation></semantics></math> block rewards.</span></figcaption>
</figure>
<div id="S7.SS2.p8" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S7.SS2.p8.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S7.SS2.p8.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Multiple MEV Miner:</span>
Our MDP model does not allow us to draw conclusions on the dynamics under multiple independent MEV miners. We hence can only speculate about the outcome and leave a simulation to future work. We can imagine that multiple miners either collaborate to share an MEV profit (which falls back to our MDP game of one adversary), or the miners would compete among each other, which is likely to exacerbate the fork rate and hence further deteriorates the blockchain consensus security.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<section id="S8" class="ltx_section">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_title_section">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_section">VIII </span><span id="S8.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">Related Work</span>
</h2>

<div id="S8.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S8.p1.1" class="ltx_p">While the research literature of blockchain span over&nbsp;10 years, DeFi is a relatively recent area with fewer works.</p>
</div>
<div id="S8.p2" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S8.p2.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S8.p2.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">DeFi:</span>
There is a growing body of literature focusing on the security of the DeFi ecosystem. Blockchain front-running in exchanges, games, gambling, mixer, the network layer, and name services is soundly studied&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib25" title="" class="ltx_ref">25</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib20" title="" class="ltx_ref">20</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib12" title="" class="ltx_ref">12</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib42" title="" class="ltx_ref">42</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib47" title="" class="ltx_ref">47</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib32" title="" class="ltx_ref">32</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib1" title="" class="ltx_ref">1</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib61" title="" class="ltx_ref">61</a>]</cite>. Daian&nbsp;<span id="S8.p2.1.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">et al.</span>&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib20" title="" class="ltx_ref">20</a>]</cite> demonstrate a thorough analysis of profiting from opportunities provided by transaction ordering.
Xu&nbsp;<span id="S8.p2.1.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">et al.</span>&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib60" title="" class="ltx_ref">60</a>]</cite> presents a detailed study of a specific market manipulation scheme, pump-and-dump, and build a prediction model that estimates the pump likelihood of each coin.
Gudgeon&nbsp;<span id="S8.p2.1.4" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">et al.</span>&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib37" title="" class="ltx_ref">37</a>]</cite> explore the possibility of a DeFi crisis due to the design weakness of DeFi protocols and present a stress testing framework.
Qin&nbsp;<span id="S8.p2.1.5" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">et al.</span>&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib53" title="" class="ltx_ref">53</a>]</cite> investigate DeFi attacks through flash loans and how to optimize their profit. We remark that the optimization solution presented in&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib53" title="" class="ltx_ref">53</a>]</cite> only applies to previously fixed attack vectors, while this work considers the composability of DeFi protocols.</p>
</div>
<div id="S8.p3" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S8.p3.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S8.p3.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Smart Contract Analysis:</span>
Besides the above-mentioned works on DeFi, many studies on the vulnerability discovery of smart contracts are related to our work&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib57" title="" class="ltx_ref">57</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib13" title="" class="ltx_ref">13</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib36" title="" class="ltx_ref">36</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib48" title="" class="ltx_ref">48</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib45" title="" class="ltx_ref">45</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib16" title="" class="ltx_ref">16</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib43" title="" class="ltx_ref">43</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib56" title="" class="ltx_ref">56</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib41" title="" class="ltx_ref">41</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib19" title="" class="ltx_ref">19</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib38" title="" class="ltx_ref">38</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib10" title="" class="ltx_ref">10</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib39" title="" class="ltx_ref">39</a>]</cite>. Traditional smart contract vulnerabilities examined in related work include, for instance, re-entrancy attack, unhandled exceptions, locked ether, overflow&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib48" title="" class="ltx_ref">48</a>]</cite>. To the best of our knowledge, no analysis tool has yet considered the problem of a <em id="S8.p3.1.2" class="ltx_emph ltx_font_italic">composability analysis</em> as we’ve performed.</p>
</div>
<div id="S8.p4" class="ltx_para ltx_noindent">
<p id="S8.p4.1" class="ltx_p"><span id="S8.p4.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Model Checking:</span>
Model-checking is another viable method to verify the security of smart contracts. Model-checking examines all possible states in a brute-force manner&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib7" title="" class="ltx_ref">7</a>]</cite> and performs systematic exhaustive exploration for checking whether a finite transition machine model of a system meets appropriate specifications&nbsp;<cite class="ltx_cite ltx_citemacro_cite">[<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib57" title="" class="ltx_ref">57</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib13" title="" class="ltx_ref">13</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib36" title="" class="ltx_ref">36</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib48" title="" class="ltx_ref">48</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib45" title="" class="ltx_ref">45</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib16" title="" class="ltx_ref">16</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib43" title="" class="ltx_ref">43</a>, <a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#bib.bib56" title="" class="ltx_ref">56</a>]</cite>. One of the main limitations of model-checking is the exponential growth of the number of possible states, resulting in unsolvability for complex contracts.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="S9" class="ltx_section">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_title_section">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_section">IX </span><span id="S9.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">Conclusions</span>
</h2>

<div id="S9.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S9.p1.11" class="ltx_p">This paper presents two practical approaches that automatically extract revenue from the intertwined mesh of decentralized finance protocols. The first technique, <span id="S9.p1.11.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span>, is well-suited for arbitrage, and the second, <span id="S9.p1.11.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span>, can also find acyclic opportunities. When evaluated over a span of&nbsp;<math id="S9.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="150" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S9.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="S9.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">150</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p1.1.m1.1.1">150</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.1.m1.1c">150</annotation></semantics></math> days with&nbsp;<math id="S9.p1.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="96" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S9.p1.2.m2.1.1" xref="S9.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml">96</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.2.m2.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p1.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p1.2.m2.1.1">96</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.2.m2.1c">96</annotation></semantics></math> DeFi actions and&nbsp;<math id="S9.p1.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="25" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.3.m3.1a"><mn id="S9.p1.3.m3.1.1" xref="S9.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml">25</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.3.m3.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p1.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p1.3.m3.1.1">25</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.3.m3.1c">25</annotation></semantics></math> cryptocurrency assets, <span id="S9.p1.11.3" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> and <span id="S9.p1.11.4" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span> are estimated to generate an average weekly revenue of&nbsp;<math id="S9.p1.4.m4.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{191.48}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.4.m4.1a"><mn id="S9.p1.4.m4.1.1" xref="S9.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml">191.48</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.4.m4.1b"><cn type="float" id="S9.p1.4.m4.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p1.4.m4.1.1">191.48</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.4.m4.1c">\numprint{191.48}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S9.p1.5.m5.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{76592}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.5.m5.2a"><mrow id="S9.p1.5.m5.2.2.4"><mn id="S9.p1.5.m5.1.1.1.1" xref="S9.p1.5.m5.2.2.3.cmml">76</mn><mo id="S9.p1.5.m5.2.2.4.1" xref="S9.p1.5.m5.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S9.p1.5.m5.2.2.2.2" xref="S9.p1.5.m5.2.2.3.cmml">592</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.5.m5.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p1.5.m5.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S9.p1.5.m5.1.1.1.1">76592</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.5.m5.2c">\numprint{76592}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) and&nbsp;<math id="S9.p1.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{72.44}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.6.m6.1a"><mn id="S9.p1.6.m6.1.1" xref="S9.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml">72.44</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.6.m6.1b"><cn type="float" id="S9.p1.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p1.6.m6.1.1">72.44</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.6.m6.1c">\numprint{72.44}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S9.p1.7.m7.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{28976}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.7.m7.2a"><mrow id="S9.p1.7.m7.2.2.4"><mn id="S9.p1.7.m7.1.1.1.1" xref="S9.p1.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml">28</mn><mo id="S9.p1.7.m7.2.2.4.1" xref="S9.p1.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S9.p1.7.m7.2.2.2.2" xref="S9.p1.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml">976</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.7.m7.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p1.7.m7.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S9.p1.7.m7.1.1.1.1">28976</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.7.m7.2c">\numprint{28976}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD), with the highest transaction being&nbsp;<math id="S9.p1.8.m8.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{81.31}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.8.m8.1a"><mn id="S9.p1.8.m8.1.1" xref="S9.p1.8.m8.1.1.cmml">81.31</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.8.m8.1b"><cn type="float" id="S9.p1.8.m8.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p1.8.m8.1.1">81.31</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.8.m8.1c">\numprint{81.31}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S9.p1.9.m9.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{32524}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.9.m9.2a"><mrow id="S9.p1.9.m9.2.2.4"><mn id="S9.p1.9.m9.1.1.1.1" xref="S9.p1.9.m9.2.2.3.cmml">32</mn><mo id="S9.p1.9.m9.2.2.4.1" xref="S9.p1.9.m9.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S9.p1.9.m9.2.2.2.2" xref="S9.p1.9.m9.2.2.3.cmml">524</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.9.m9.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p1.9.m9.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S9.p1.9.m9.1.1.1.1">32524</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.9.m9.2c">\numprint{32524}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) and&nbsp;<math id="S9.p1.10.m10.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{22.40}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.10.m10.1a"><mn id="S9.p1.10.m10.1.1" xref="S9.p1.10.m10.1.1.cmml">22.40</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.10.m10.1b"><cn type="float" id="S9.p1.10.m10.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p1.10.m10.1.1">22.40</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.10.m10.1c">\numprint{22.40}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S9.p1.11.m11.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{8960}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p1.11.m11.2a"><mrow id="S9.p1.11.m11.2.2.4"><mn id="S9.p1.11.m11.1.1.1.1" xref="S9.p1.11.m11.2.2.3.cmml">8</mn><mo id="S9.p1.11.m11.2.2.4.1" xref="S9.p1.11.m11.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S9.p1.11.m11.2.2.2.2" xref="S9.p1.11.m11.2.2.3.cmml">960</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p1.11.m11.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p1.11.m11.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S9.p1.11.m11.1.1.1.1">8960</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p1.11.m11.2c">\numprint{8960}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD), respectively.</p>
</div>
<div id="S9.p2" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S9.p2.6" class="ltx_p">Our techniques apply to a real-time operation on blockchains with reasonably fast inter-block times (such as Ethereum), with an average search of&nbsp;<math id="S9.p2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="6.43" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p2.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S9.p2.1.m1.1.1" xref="S9.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml">6.43</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p2.1.m1.1b"><cn type="float" id="S9.p2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p2.1.m1.1.1">6.43</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p2.1.m1.1c">6.43</annotation></semantics></math> seconds and&nbsp;<math id="S9.p2.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="5.39" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p2.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S9.p2.2.m2.1.1" xref="S9.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml">5.39</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p2.2.m2.1b"><cn type="float" id="S9.p2.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p2.2.m2.1.1">5.39</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p2.2.m2.1c">5.39</annotation></semantics></math> seconds per block for <span id="S9.p2.6.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-ARB</span> and <span id="S9.p2.6.2" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser-SMT</span>, respectively, using a relatively unoptimized implementation. We find that the capital requirements to extract the found revenues are minimal: the majority of strategies produced require less than&nbsp;<math id="S9.p2.3.m3.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{150.00}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p2.3.m3.1a"><mn id="S9.p2.3.m3.1.1" xref="S9.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml">150.00</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p2.3.m3.1b"><cn type="float" id="S9.p2.3.m3.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p2.3.m3.1.1">150.00</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p2.3.m3.1c">\numprint{150.00}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S9.p2.4.m4.2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{60000}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p2.4.m4.2a"><mrow id="S9.p2.4.m4.2.2.4"><mn id="S9.p2.4.m4.1.1.1.1" xref="S9.p2.4.m4.2.2.3.cmml">60</mn><mo id="S9.p2.4.m4.2.2.4.1" xref="S9.p2.4.m4.2.2.3.cmml">,</mo><mn id="S9.p2.4.m4.2.2.2.2" xref="S9.p2.4.m4.2.2.3.cmml">000</mn></mrow><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p2.4.m4.2b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p2.4.m4.2.2.3.cmml" xref="S9.p2.4.m4.1.1.1.1">60000</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p2.4.m4.2c">\numprint{60000}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD), without, and less than&nbsp;<math id="S9.p2.5.m5.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{1.00}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p2.5.m5.1a"><mn id="S9.p2.5.m5.1.1" xref="S9.p2.5.m5.1.1.cmml">1.00</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p2.5.m5.1b"><cn type="float" id="S9.p2.5.m5.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p2.5.m5.1.1">1.00</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p2.5.m5.1c">\numprint{1.00}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;ETH (<math id="S9.p2.6.m6.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\numprint{400}" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p2.6.m6.1a"><mn id="S9.p2.6.m6.1.1" xref="S9.p2.6.m6.1.1.cmml">400</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p2.6.m6.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p2.6.m6.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p2.6.m6.1.1">400</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p2.6.m6.1c">\numprint{400}</annotation></semantics></math>&nbsp;USD) with flash loans.</p>
</div>
<div id="S9.p3" class="ltx_para">
<p id="S9.p3.3" class="ltx_p">We quantitatively demonstrate some troubling security implications of profitable transactions on the blockchain consensus. Given optimal adversarial strategies provided by a Markov Decision Process, we quantify the threshold value at which an MEV-aware rational miner will fork the blockchain if the miner does not succeed in claiming an unconfirmed MEV opportunity first. For example, on the current Ethereum network, a&nbsp;<math id="S9.p3.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="10" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p3.1.m1.1a"><mn id="S9.p3.1.m1.1.1" xref="S9.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml">10</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p3.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p3.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p3.1.m1.1.1">10</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p3.1.m1.1c">10</annotation></semantics></math>% hash rate miner will fork the chain if an MEV opportunity exceeds&nbsp;<math id="S9.p3.2.m2.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="4" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p3.2.m2.1a"><mn id="S9.p3.2.m2.1.1" xref="S9.p3.2.m2.1.1.cmml">4</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="S9.p3.2.m2.1b"><cn type="integer" id="S9.p3.2.m2.1.1.cmml" xref="S9.p3.2.m2.1.1">4</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p3.2.m2.1c">4</annotation></semantics></math> block rewards. As a comparison, the bZx opportunity exceeded the Ethereum block reward by a factor of&nbsp;<math id="S9.p3.3.m3.1" class="ltx_math_unparsed" alttext="874\times" display="inline"><semantics id="S9.p3.3.m3.1a"><mrow id="S9.p3.3.m3.1b"><mn id="S9.p3.3.m3.1.1">874</mn><mo lspace="0.222em" id="S9.p3.3.m3.1.2">×</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="S9.p3.3.m3.1c">874\times</annotation></semantics></math>! Our work hence quantifies the inherent tension between revenue extraction from profitable transactions and blockchain security. We can generally expect trading opportunities highlighted in this paper to expand as the DeFi ecosystem grows and becomes more popular.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="Sx1" class="ltx_section">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_font_smallcaps ltx_title_section">Acknowledgments</h2>

<div id="Sx1.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="Sx1.p1.1" class="ltx_p">We very much thank the anonymous reviewers and Nicolas Christin for the thorough reviews and helpful suggestions that significantly strengthened this paper. We are moreover grateful to the Lucerne University of Applied Sciences and Arts for generously supporting Kaihua Qin’s Ph.D.</p>
</div>

</section>

<span class="ltx_bibblock">In <span id="bib.bib59.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">2018 Crypto Valley Conference on Blockchain Technology
(CVCBT)</span>, pages 45–54. IEEE, 2018.

</span>
</li>
<li id="bib.bib60" class="ltx_bibitem">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_bibitem">[60]</span>
<span class="ltx_bibblock">
Jiahua Xu and Benjamin Livshits.

</span>
<span class="ltx_bibblock">The anatomy of a cryptocurrency pump-and-dump scheme.

</span>
<span class="ltx_bibblock">In <span id="bib.bib60.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">Proceedings of the Usenix Security Symposium</span>, August 2019.

</span>
</li>
<li id="bib.bib61" class="ltx_bibitem">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_bibitem">[61]</span>
<span class="ltx_bibblock">
Liyi Zhou, Kaihua Qin, Christof&nbsp;Ferreira Torres, Duc&nbsp;V Le, and Arthur Gervais.

</span>
<span class="ltx_bibblock">High-frequency trading on decentralized on-chain exchanges.

</span>
<span class="ltx_bibblock"><span id="bib.bib61.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_italic">IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy</span>, 2021.

</span>
</li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="A1" class="ltx_appendix">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_title_appendix">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_appendix">Appendix A </span>Summary of the ERC-20 cryptocurrency assets</h2>

<div id="A1.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="A1.p1.1" class="ltx_p">We summarize the <math id="A1.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="24" display="inline"><semantics id="A1.p1.1.m1.1a"><mn id="A1.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="A1.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">24</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="A1.p1.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="A1.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="A1.p1.1.m1.1.1">24</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="A1.p1.1.m1.1c">24</annotation></semantics></math> ERC-20 cryptocurrency assets in Table&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A1.T3" title="TABLE III ‣ Appendix A Summary of the ERC-20 cryptocurrency assets ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">III</span></a>. We observe that for most of the assets, the number of holders and the number of markets increases with the number of transfer transactions.</p>
</div>
<figure id="A1.T3" class="ltx_table">
<table id="A1.T3.4" class="ltx_tabular ltx_guessed_headers ltx_align_middle">

<figcaption class="ltx_caption"><span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_table"><span id="A1.T3.5.2.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">TABLE III</span>: </span><span id="A1.T3.2.1" class="ltx_text" style="font-size:90%;">
Summary of the <math id="A1.T3.2.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="24" display="inline"><semantics id="A1.T3.2.1.m1.1b"><mn id="A1.T3.2.1.m1.1.1" xref="A1.T3.2.1.m1.1.1.cmml">24</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="A1.T3.2.1.m1.1c"><cn type="integer" id="A1.T3.2.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="A1.T3.2.1.m1.1.1">24</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="A1.T3.2.1.m1.1d">24</annotation></semantics></math> ERC-20 cryptocurrency assets used in our experiments, ordered by the total number of transfer transactions.</span></figcaption>
</figure>
</section>
<section id="A2" class="ltx_appendix">
<h2 class="ltx_title ltx_title_appendix">
<span class="ltx_tag ltx_tag_appendix">Appendix B </span>Supported DeFi actions</h2>

<div id="A2.p1" class="ltx_para">
<p id="A2.p1.1" class="ltx_p">We summarize the <math id="A2.p1.1.m1.1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="96" display="inline"><semantics id="A2.p1.1.m1.1a"><mn id="A2.p1.1.m1.1.1" xref="A2.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml">96</mn><annotation-xml encoding="MathML-Content" id="A2.p1.1.m1.1b"><cn type="integer" id="A2.p1.1.m1.1.1.cmml" xref="A2.p1.1.m1.1.1">96</cn></annotation-xml><annotation encoding="application/x-tex" id="A2.p1.1.m1.1c">96</annotation></semantics></math> DeFi actions <span id="A2.p1.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_smallcaps">DeFiPoser</span> supports in Table&nbsp;<a href="https://ar5iv.labs.arxiv.org/html/2103.02228#A2.T4" title="TABLE IV ‣ Appendix B Supported DeFi actions ‣ On the Just-In-Time Discovery of Profit-Generating Transactions in DeFi Protocols" class="ltx_ref"><span class="ltx_text ltx_ref_tag">IV</span></a>. All considered cryptocurrency assets trade on both the Uniswap and Bancor exchanges. SAI and DAI, in addition, can be converted to each on MakerDAO.</p>
</div>
<figure id="A2.T4" class="ltx_table">
<table id="A2.T4.2" class="ltx_tabular ltx_centering ltx_align_middle">
<tbody class="ltx_tbody">
<tr id="A2.T4.2.1.1" class="ltx_tr">
<td id="A2.T4.2.1.1.1" class="ltx_td ltx_align_center ltx_border_tt" colspan="2"><span id="A2.T4.2.1.1.1.1" class="ltx_text ltx_font_bold">Uniswap</span></td>
